description:
I think that I have found pizza heaven. This conveniently located place has the best pizza in town. They are fast, friendly and efficient. Another thing that is so awesome about this place is that they unbeatable prices. They by far have the best pizza pice in town.

I like the classic so I usually get cheese pizza and it is delicious. But they also have a very tasty selection. Overall best pizza place in town
author: Alexthebest 8.

description:
As a NYC transplant and native to the NYC area, I'm pretty snobby about my pizza. With that said, this place has the closest to authentically "New York style" pizza I've had since moving to SF. 

There are plenty of slice varieties are available, with grated cheese, pepper flakes and the like to dress up your slice as you wish. It can be enjoyed there (ample seating) or to go (travels well). The crust is thin but not too thin (where it's cardboard-like), the cheese and sauce come together in the right ratio, and the crust has a nice texture and bite without being overdone (or underdone and gummy). Plus, the owners and everyone I've met working there are generally nice and friendly. 

Cash only. Slices are about $4 which I guess is the going rate for such a thing these days.
author: Christine G.

description:
I ordered a pizza for delivery. In my instructions I wrote to call my cell phone because my doorbell does not work.

The driver called. I missed the call. I called back literally 3 seconds later. The driver did not pick up. He didn't return my call. I called a few more times. He then blocked my call. I was charged $32.62 for a pizza that I never received. 

I called the restaurant and wrote to Caviar. The restaurant said they would try to see what they could do. No promises as the drivers don't work for them. The restaurant still gets paid because Caviar delivery steels money from their customers and pays them. I never heard back from anyone. 

I will never use either business again. Pizza Shop gets one star for using a service that doesn't deliver! I wish I could tell you what their pizza tastes like but I never got it!

How is it possible that customer service can be this bad and businesses are still functioning?
author: Kathy J.

description:
Pretty pretty good . I need to make a pizza place list...(don't have one).

The pizza shop I think would be up there on the list (not my absolute fave but definite upper tier in SF).

Went with a slice of White Spinach and Pepperoni/Pineapple.

Both slices were $4 a pop . CASH ONLY. 

Once selected they placed the slices in the oven and shortly thereafter we were munching down on these thin crust slices. 

Good price, good friendly service. 

Wish they took plastic ...but a good solid option on 24th street in the Mission nevertheless!
author: Rod M.

description:
Excellent service, delicious pizza, what more can you ask for? 

Note: when we were there, they were cash only. 

We stopped in for a quick slice on our way home. Hot gooey pizza, in massive slices. (The sausage has super fresh fennel which was also a plus.) It was wonderful. The service was good, and the options they had were very west coast style. Overall, I'll def be back for a quick slice.
author: Sophie W.

description: Yo this place was tight as hell. The slices are pretty large. Reasonable price for SF. I got 3 for $12. Pepperoni and mushroom=can't fuck up that classic. Personally my favorite because it had the most flavor. White spinach pizza=delicious as hell with beautiful and equal clumps of spin and cheese. White mushroom pizza=flavorful subtle hints of mushroom so yum. The crust is both crispy and doughy. This might be my fave pizza place in town!!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
I lived in Manhattan for 6.5 years after undergrad (and lived in the tri-state region my entire life prior) so I've had my fair share of NY slices.  While the Bay Area has many nice made-to-order personal pies, its slice game is generally lacking (except Tony's and Arinell).  I'm glad my other lunch plans fell through because this backup option was a great experience for me.  Way better than Arinell and very much like the omnipresent slices I used to get when I lived in NYC.

Cheese Slice: Just how a slice should be!  The bottom is so crispy and firm that, after a few bites, you don't need to fold to prevent a flop down.  The sauce layer is thin, which is true to NY style, though always a bit of a let down for me since sauce is my favorite part.  The cheese is ample and neatly intact since it's reheated to order (instead of the super stringy version the first time round).  And they have the four requisite shakers: chili flakes, parmesan cheese, oregano and garlic salt.  For $3, it's the perfect trip down NY memory lane. 

Pepperoni Slice: Essentially the same as the cheese, but with about 5 slices of thin pepperoni.  It was tasty enough, but I would have preferred the meat to be more charred and crispy.  Probably better to save the $1 and just get a cheese slice.
author: Adam B.

description: They serve really good pizza the way I like it: thin crisp crust, delicious tomato sauce and fresh toppings. Zero shop-type atmosphere, no beer, just soda & water. And it's 4 bucks a slice so don't bitch. Hands-down the best slice in San Francisco. Even better than Golden Boy in North Beach, & I never thought that would be possible. If you just want a slice of really good pizza, you'd be a fool to not check this place out.
author: Scott F.

description:
Just a tip about this place they ONLY ACCEPT CASH. I repeat (No cards, no checks, no bribes, and no side boob; just cash)

There is an atm towards the back of the store. 

The price is fairly rounded for a slice of pizza in the city.($4.00)

Their spinach pizza is my all-time favorite: ricotta cheese, with spinach, olive oil on thin crust. I find it less wasteful seeing that they use less dough; just the right amount where your not stuck tossing the pizza crust into a nearby dumpster. 

I tried their regular pepperoni pizza, and all meat pizza nothing to ride home about it, but I enjoyed finishing it.
author: Elijajuan F.

description: One of my favorite pizza spots in the city. FYI it's cash only. The pizza here are large thin slices. They have it on display, you order and they heat it up/finish it in the oven before you get it. If you're a fan of thin crust pizza this is the spot. The pizza isn't doughy, nice perfect crispy bites. The toppings are fresh and a good balance, they don't pile on too much to overwhelm it. It's the closest thing to proper east coast-ish pizza I've found in SF. The staff here were really friendly and welcoming. Definitely will be back
author: Peter P.

description: Poser NY Pizza. They tried and became the closest thing to it in the city of SF. Quality toppings as well. $3 for cheese and $4 for anything else. Enjoy you Californians!
author: Liam P.

description:
Very good recreation of a New York slice-reminds me of the dollar slice places in the east village or Ben's pizza by NYU (on McDougal). 

Three bucks for a plain slice is a little pricey and the slices aren't as big as traditional NY slices but I know the rent is high in the Mission. It's right across from Philz in the heart of the Mission and I hope they do right by the neighborhood, hire locals, donate leftover food, engage with the community, etc.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Hands down the best pizza spot in the city. In fact, gives even the best NY shops a run for their money. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a quality slice.
author: Ian H.

description: On second thought yes pizza is good but thats because I really like thin crust. Now on to the service...it  really really sucks, the white guy with glasses and black hat gosh he has no customer service skills.. dry dry dry and then he stares at you while you eat. No thanks! Just a weird vibe overall.
author: Vee N.

description:
This is the perfect neighborhood pizza joint. It was quick, cheap, and easy with a pleasant atmosphere all-around. 

Cheese slices are $3 and everything else is $4. The whole process is incredibly fast and efficient. Just make sure you have cash!

There isn't a huge variety, but what they had was absolutely delicious. We tried the spinach white pizza, mushroom, pepperoni, and sausage. The crust was perfectly crispy and the toppings tasted great. I'll definitely be back here when my craving for pizza arises again.
author: Jenny D.

description: Best Pizza I've had in SF. The tomato garlic is surprisingly good--better when it's by the slice, in my opinion. Friendly staff and a cute (and small) dining area. Cash only can be hard, but no complaints.
author: Edward F.

description: If you like thin crust NY style pizza then this is your place. The crust is thin but has the right amount of crisp and chewiness for the perfect balance. The cheese has excellent stretch and the toppings are always fresh. I love getting mushroom and pepperoni (check out my pic). I've been going here for over a year and it's consistently delicious.
author: V J.

description:
******CASH ONLY*******

Seating is super limited so plan your visit accordingly and maybe be prepared to take your order to go. 

Ordered 2 slices: cherry tomato & pesto, pineapple & pepperoni. 

What an amazing slice of pizza! Not too oily, great topping combinations, and the perfect thin crust. Definitely satisfies a craving and is quite filling as well. 

Side note: I actually prefer this thin crust over slices I've had in NYC. But value wise, this is about $4/slice while NYC is cheaper and gives out larger slices. ‍
author: Ida H.

description:
Classic NY style pizza. This review is for slices only and not whole pies. $3 for cheese slices, $4 for slices with toppings. It's cash only! These prices include tax, as it should, so you don't get left with spare coins.

I got two slices--the mushroom+ricotta and the meat slice. Both had a crispy crust that definitely held up, which is generally uncommon with some of the greasier toppings like pepperoni and sausage.

Most people want to hear a comparison between this and "real NY pizza". But just remember that there's probably 20 different "top" pizza shops out there. Everyone has their preferences, and every place makes their pizza different, some better than others though! 

I like my pizza a little chewier and cheesier, but the crust was definitely perfectly crispy. I'm not sure what it was, but the pizza tasted a little bland though, it could have been the sauce, cheese, crust, or a combination of the three.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Awesome slices -- you choose from pizza pies that are sitting in a modified bakery display case, which is funky & cool and makes it all look extremely appetizing.  I love how they have both traditional toppings and some unique ones -- my favorite being pepperoni & pineapple (much prefer this over most other shops serving the more traditional pepperoni & candian bacon or ham).

Plain slices have that gorgeous golden-orange sheen that will definitely make you think "New York slice," except not as massive in size (but very rare to get slices in SF as large as NY anyway).

Flavor is perfection, and quality ingredients, consistency, nice interior, and AWESOME folks behind the counter make this a great place to come back to again and again.  (Also, extra points for having a CLEAN, modern restroom!)

I will add that The Pizza Shop is tied with Marcello's in the Castro for my favorite NY slice in SF*  -- except Marcello's can, at times, be inconsistent, including sauce being exposed where the cheese meets the crust (a NY no-no!) and globbed-on cheese (WTF?) -- depends who's pizza chef on whatever day you're there -- but most times a good competitor for best NY slice with this place.  

Although I do have to say that one thing Marcello's has over The Pizza Shop is a nice slightly messy slice that you can fold, while here the pizza is very neat & tidy (yup!) and the bottom crust is a bit crunchy, so this ain't gonna be an easy foldable slice.  But that can be easily overlooked given the great taste and quality.

*I'm originally from NY (uh huh), and yes, I've been to Arinell's and, no, not anywhere near my fave NY slice.
author: Merrick W.

description: Nice big slice of pepperoni and mushrooms. Perfectly thin crisp on the bottom and full of flavor on top!
author: Brenda M.

description:
Let me tell you about the time The Pizza Shop saved my life. 

Picture this: A barely functioning and quickly dying hungover human trying to find anything, ANYTHING to satiate the ridiculously hunger-nauseous body my poor, unfortunate soul resides in. Cool, so now picture my angel of a girlfriend trying to find me anything I would be willing to eat with a limited amount of time before I literally keeled over and died. But enough about my poor life decisions, because going to The Pizza Shop was a great decision. 

I'd heard good things about this place from Serious Eats king Kenji Lopez-Alt. I ordered a slice of pineapple and pepperoni pizza which came out to $4 cash (only). I kid you not, with every bite I took of that pizza death slowly, slowly started to loosen its grip on me. The crust was the right consistency (thinnnnnn, baby), the sauce was tasty and the toppings were classic. I wish the actual crust had been a little less crunchy as I prefer a chewier crust that still has some bite.

Atmosphere is clean and cool, service was quick but friendly. 

Overall, The Pizza Shop is a super solid slice shop with some pretty fun slice combinations that I'd love to come back and try!
author: Alex K.

description:
#WhiteMushroom #TheJulian
The best pizza I ever had in my life !!!
Orgasm in my mouth
author: Alice K.

description:
I love having this pizza place in my neighborhood! I think it's the only one within walking distance and it's a nice alternative to all the Taquerias. 

I really like the crust- it's not too thick nor too thin- 
I don't like folding my pizza over like a New Yorker and I hate floppy, drippy pizza. This one's kind of crispy and holds up nicely when you pick it up. Depending on my mood (carefree or princess) I could eat it with my hands or with a fork and knife and not make a big mess. 

The toppings are yummy, spicy, and pretty. I really like the mushroom & ricotta and the cherry peppers & pesto. 

The guys at the counter are friendly and you get to watch them skillfully make pies one after the other in a very clean kitchen. 

I do have ONE complaint tho... 
They are a Cash Only establishment. That's SUCH a bummer! I would eat there more often if they accepted some form of electronic payment. I've had to walk by sadly at times because I hardly ever carry cash. True, there's an ATM inside... but I'm not gonna pay to pay... I hope this changes in the near future :/

They offer delivery through a third party (Caviar?) in case you want a whole pie sent to you :)
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Pizza at 11am? Why not? 

Atmosphere: a comfortable and clean layout. A mostly white room with pops of green with a visible kitchen area that is obviously well maintained.

Ordering: CASH ONLY! Which is weird since it's pretty modern place. 

Bathroom: gender neutral

Staff: pretty happy!

Pizza: honestly I wasn't enthused. The crust was super thin and crispy. It felt like I was biting into a cheesy cracker rather than pizza. The crust was also very bland and dry. 

I had the white mushroom pizza which had a nice flavor but it wasn't consistent all the way through. Some bites had a nice hint of garlic, other bites was just a mouthful of bland cheese and mushrooms. 

I didn't spend over $10 for a slice and a small cup of mountain soda so I got exactly what I paid for. A cheap slice. 

Would I come back? I don't think so.
author: Bobbi A.

description: As a kid from NYC specifically The Bronx this pizza is freaking on point. If you want a New York style slice come here. Pizza by the slice is pretty rare in SF, like a rare Pokémon. I normally get a white pizza which is ricotta cheese and mozzarella but this time I added some sausage and spinach to my whole pie. The crust is perfect not too hard or soft (I eat my pizza backwards, crust first) great structure when you fold your pizza and eat it on the go. I think good pizza should fold like a paper plane but that's just me. Good amount of cheese and sauce ratio.
author: Antonio I.

description:
I live in the Mission yet it took move over a year to finally try this place?! I'm disappointed in myself for not visiting this place sooner because the pizzas here are simply amazing and very affordable as well!

I decided to stop by after going back and forth on what I wanted to eat for dinner. I finally decided to eat at the Pizza Shop because I was feeling cheap and didn't want to splurge on a heavy burrito that was going to give me the ultimate food coma. 

I ordered a slice of the White Spinach and another slice of the Mushroom (I was hungry and ate 2 for myself, no judgement!). Both pizzas were  phenomenal and the White Spinach was my absolute favorite! I devoured both slices in minutes and had no regrets because it was just so darn tasty!

If you're looking for a quick snack and craving some simple thin crust pizza, then be sure to visit this place. You won't regret it. Cash only!
author: MyTien P.

description:
Afternoon delivery to Duboce Triangle via Caviar: White Spinach

Verdict from a Massachusetts native: A-Ok (3 stars). Arrived hot and fresh and pristine. It looked very photogenic.

Unfortunately, it struck me as bland, which does not seem the case for many lovers of this pizza here on Yelp. I could taste the mild ricotta, a bit of chopped garlic, the subtle saltiness of what seemed like drained canned spinach, but it needed more something. I added salt, which I don't normally do to pizza. It helped a bit. Crust is good, crisp, not too thin, not too thick. Bonus: Edges very good. Maybe I will try adding some white vinegar to it... for real! Back in Pittsfield, Massachusetts, I used to get an amazing veggie white pizza with vinegar on the side from Papa Joe's Ristorante & Pizzeria. The vinegar really brought that pizza up to crazy high delicious levels. Will update review with result of my pizza doctoring.  

Don't get me wrong, this is good pizza but I feel like it could be more. I will try other offerings from The Pizza Shop in future to fill out this review some more.
author: Sarah J.

description:
Love this place! I come here primarily for the cherry pepper pesto slice- such a great combo of flavors! 

Seating is usually not too hard to get, there's a clean bathroom for customers, and there's an ATM I think if you forget to bring cash.
author: Kate P.

description:
A slice of magic from this local hole in the wall joint will have you wanting for more and more, and when you leave out the door when you're finished you Will be get nostalgic of the happy minutes you spend in here. 

Whether it's that cracklin crunch when you first bite in that makes you almost feeling perverse for feeling that pure unadulterated joy, or that perfect blend of cheese and toppings that make you wonder why all the pizzas out there aren't this way, they have their pizzas down, having focused on and succeeded in getting the basics down. So take a chance on walking in here, order a slice or two (of course you have to get two), sit down on these green chairs and enjoy what good life we are all living in in this blissful place.
author: Al L.

description:
Native New Yorker here commenting on the cheese slice:

The Great:
Authentic NY cheese pizza flavor explosion
Melty, stretchy cheese that will burn your mouth (for the better)
Tangy and sweet tomato sauce that hits the spot
Crunchy, chewy, thin (but not too thin) crust
It's as close to a NY slice as you'll get in the bay area

The Not So Great:
There could be a LITTLE bit more sauce... but this is obviously preferential... 
The owner is a bit terse and could stand to smile and warm up to customers when he is talking to them
He seems like a great guy and I think this will only help!

Important to note that he threw in a free slice when he saw that one of our cheese slices looked a little funky (crust was kind of smashed in one section). Totally didn't need to do it but he did and we were really thankful!

Overall, this has become our go to spot for NY style pizza. If they added a bit more tomato sauce, I think they would nail it head on but it's only a small detail. Will be coming back again and again!
author: David H.

description:
I have had my fair share of pizza, same as any other human being. I have also walked and driven past this pizza shop too many times to count. Any time I was in the neighborhood the name always made me laugh and think, "wow 'The Pizza Shop' how minimal and to the hipster point." But after having a slice of pepperoni last night I had to eat my previously sarcastic words. 

That CRUST omg that thin, crispy, with a nice crunch crust was amazing. Pepperoni, cheese and sauce were great too, but the reason I am definitely visiting again soon is that amazing crust
author: Moni M.

description: Very rude service and attitude by the person "serving" pizza. Tried the White cheese and spinach pizza which I actually found pretty nice. I found this pizza shop to be quite expensive. $4 for a slice of pizza...
author: Angelo N.

description: Absolutely love love this place! Considering it's the closest thing us San Francisco people have to NY pizza, It's so good. I order the meat o pizza and plain cheese and it's just fabulous! This place is a new favorite!
author: Amber R.

description: Great Pizza!!! We have ordered delivery a couple of times and decided to go to the restaurant tonight! We have always had great pizza from them. The restaurant was so clean and super cute! Will definitely be dining in again!! :)
author: Kay B.

description: If you love New York style pizza, this is the best pizza in San Francisco! I specially enjoyed the ricotta pizza. The staff are friendly and accommodating.
author: Alexander L.

description: In the running for the best slice in the city. Its your quintessential NY style slice crispy and paper thin with a good crust char. The pizza is similar in style, price, and quality to mission rival Arinell but id give them an edge due to having much more variety including some good white pizzas and a nice environment with tables for dining in vs just a to go counter.
author: Sean G.

description:
The pizza is similar in style, price and quality to the famous Arinell in the mission, (as mentioned in other reviews). 

I spoke to a staff member behind the counter and he said the pizza originates from New Jersey, with the signature thin and crispy bottom.

I ordered a cheese slice and it came out of the oven crisped at the bottom and the cheese was melted perfectly. The pizza was tasty. I think the sauce coulda had more of a zing and the slice overall coulda been more saucy, (I prefer more sauce) but it had a proper amount of cheese, which I'll never complain about.

I can't give input for other varied pizza options like white pizza and veggie. They look delicious, and I will try them another time.

I'll have to give Arinell a bit of edge on the cheese slice though.

Ambiance has modern hipster style. The staff is nice. It's all good in the mission hood.
author: Shruti D.

description: So I've lived in the Bay Area for 13 years and have been on a seemingly never ending quest for good east coast style pizza, and I'm happy to say I've finally found it. This place has the perfect cheese:sauce ratio and the perfect thin crust thickness. They serve only pizza, no salads or other sides, which is totally fine with me. You can get delivery though Caviar. The. Best.
author: Danielle B.

description: The best pizza I ever had anywhere in Bay Area!! A must must try and you'll love it, think crust, tasty toppings and great staff!!
author: Jay G.

description:
When you look at The Pizza Shop from the outside, it doesn't look like anything super magnificent or fancy - a clean shop with a few tables and an open kitchen. I was walking past with my friend after grabbing a small bite for dinner when I muttered, "Hey a pizza shop". The lady in front of us, who was initially on her phone let us know this is one of the best places in town - so we decided to stop in for a bite!

The prices are including tax! It was $3 for a cheese pizza, $4 for any of the other pizzas they had on display! It's an extra $2 for any additional toppings for the order! Only two people were working when we went in, but the order didn't take too long. One of the workers make the pizza and it looks super easy cause they end up making it in 5 minutes. The other worker takes the order, collects the money (cash only btw), and heats up the pizza to a perfect temperature in an oven!

We ordered the pepperoni and mushroom pizza! It was on a thin, crunchy crust. When you take a bite from the pizza, it's a mixed flavour of stringy cheese with diced up mushrooms and pepperoni all in one bite! I haven't had pizza this good since I went to Italy! The pizza slices are  fairly large in size - image a medium pizza cut into 5 or 6 slices (about the size of one slice).

I recommend visiting the Pizza Shop next time you're in the area - it's a local treasure!
author: Kristy N.

description:
The best part of the pizza eating experience here is the airy, crunchy crust! The crust manages to be light, crispy (not soggy at all even in the first bite), and holds up all of the toppings. I had a slice of the ricotta, mushroom, mozzarella, and garlic. CANNOT go wrong with florettes of creamy ricotta spoonfuls. I also had a slice with onion, roasted red pepper, and mushrooms. Tasty, but I will definitely go for a ricotta slice next time or the cherry peppers and pesto. 

Another great part about this place is that it's inviting, unpretentious, and affordable. The clientele that came in while I was eating was very diverse. There are a variety of pizza flavors to choose from including the "simple man's pepperoni" to fancier fare like the ricotta spinach. The ingredients are not overly gourmet and that's all good!

This place is CASH ONLY. Slices are $4 (cheese $3). There are a four tables in the place if you want to dine in. Will definitely be back if I am in the neighborhood and want convenient, tasty food.
author: Emily P.

description: Pizza is pretty good. You order then they cook it on the spot. Giving three stars because you have to pay with cash and their pizza is only thin crust. Would eat here again tho
author: Kelsey Z.

description: Great New York style pizza slices,friendly employees reasonably priced.
author: Susan S.

description: Traveled across town just to get a slice. And, even after ordering our initial pizza, went back for seconds and thirds-that's how good it is. It's also located in a vibrant and colorful neighborhood in San Francisco with an amazing history.
author: Aimee B.

description: Slices of Pizza were fresh and delicious. Kids friendly place. Great customer service because they helped me cut the pizza into 2 (smaller slice for the kids).
author: Mila N.

description: I'm from the East Coast which is where great pizza comes from. The pizza here is a refreshing change from the typical substandard west coast expression. Great crust and great flavor combos = it's a winner!
author: Thatcher H.

description: Took a substantial amount of time to deliver a slice. Was not accommodating whatsoever.
author: Nadia B.

description:
Cash only.
A bit pricey for totally average NY slices. ($4)
Nice clean interior

Words and more words for Yelps word requirement even though no one reads past the stars and pictures
author: Alex R.

description: Super friendly staff! Spinach pizza was yummy! They were kind enough to take me order the day before so I can pick up at noon the following day.
author: Lynn C.

description:
The Pizza Shop is one of the better pizza places you'll find in the Mission. One thing I noticed straight away was that it's super clean by pizza place standards. 

The slices are pretty delicious but there is no middle ground i.e. they are either vegetarian or pork based. I've been here on multiple occasions and have tried the pesto, the King Julian, cheese slices and the mushroom pizza and I think it would be fair to say that I've never left this place disappointed.

The guys behind the counter are pretty cool although I think one of them checks-in to the business every single day and is duke of the Pizza Shop! Give the others a chance man! ;)
author: Gaurav K.

description: This place was GREAT ! Pizza was phenomenal I got the tomato garlic slice it was one of the best tasting pizza slice I ever had although I'm not a huge fan of thin crust this pizza really knocked my socks off. The employee wasn't all that kind or welcoming but definitely shouldn't be a reason why I'd leave less than 5 stars the pizza makes up for it!
author: Peter G.

description: Great place in the mission district offering pizza by the slice. Pick out your slice ($3-4) and they'll heat it up for you. The crust comes out super crunchy and thin which I enjoyed. The place takes cash only but there is an ATM inside. Thoroughly enjoyed the laidback atmosphere and was a great for a place to grab a quick bite. Very clean inside, and the toppings on my slices tasted great. Hardest part was deciding which type of pizza to go for!
author: Kenny L.

description:
Yummy, yummy, yummy!!

I had one slice of pepperoni, one slice of cheese (I'm a simple woman) and they were both DELICIOUS!! Like, 'lemme get your number and take you home to momma, chef' delicious. 'Please be my personal cook' delicious. 'I'd sacrifice my first born for a full pie every day of my life' delicious. 'Did I just pee my pants from excitement or is that the remnants of a wet daydream?' delicious.

Ok you get the idea.

It's a quaint little shop in the mission--kinda what you'd expect. Decorated in some clean, hipster-esque Ikea furniture. Not too crowded as most people grab their slice to go, so the three sets of tables are no issue. There's an ATM with a cutesy lil neon sign accompanying it in the back. Completing the setup, they have a restroom; the entrance adorned in faux-leaves really wraps up the "we love gentrification" vibe. (Ok, I had to get one gentrification joke in there).

The dudes in the back are real cool and casual, nice price point, nice ambiance. Will return when I'm back in the city!!
author: Shavonne B.

description: Pizza is delicious! Worth the wait. We drove about 2 hours to come and try this pizza and we were not disappointed. Only thing that could be a bummer is they're cash only. Otherwise great.
author: Whit W.

description:
Best NY style slice shop in SF. Cash only. 

FOOD: I love thin crust pizza, and unlike in New York, you must actively seek it out in SF. I walked in out of convenience and emerged a huge fan! You can order pizzas whole or by the slice. If you buy by the slice, they will heat it up to toasty perfection for you in the oven. 

SERVICE: Employees are laid back and fun to chat with. All the New York pizza with none of the NY attitude ;). They have had periodic closures over the holidays or just for well deserved breaks, so give them a call ahead of time if you're planning to do a trek out there. 

AMBIANCE: Casual with some fun deer wall decals up and lightweight metal seats.
author: Helen W.

description: Literally the BEST slice of pie this side of the Mississippi! I have been missing the delicious slices you can get in just about every neighborhood in NYC. California is great for whole pizzas, but not necessarily the slice shop. This is it, Folks! Perfect in every way for what you're looking for in a slice. I love this place, I now can claim SF has a delicious slice shop, and my rant is done. Come here for the pizza and get transported!
author: Lisa R.

description: Crispy, light, and wonderfully cheesy! We got the white spinach pizza, and omg, I've never had a NY pizza, but I think this is the closest I'll get to the real thing while I'm in CA! The flavor wasn't too intense nor heavy, the crust was sooooo thin, and when you bite into that cheese and pull away, strings of cheese will remain between your mouth and the rest of the pizza. Now, to up your pizza game, pour on the granulated garlic and chili flakes, and BAM your pizza is a work of art!
author: Jacqueline T.

description: True New York style pizza! I've been looking for a place like this in SF for ages. The crust is thin, dense, and chewy, just as God intended it. If you're looking for brick-oven pizza, look elsewhere!
author: George F.

description: Seen they had a print out in the window of their yelp status. Rated #1 in the city, that's impressive! So I decided to give it a try the price was high but being the #1 pizza place in SF I had to try at least a slice. It was good the crisp crust, just the right amount of cheese, the slice was small it's my only complaint.
author: Rasheed M.

description: Pretty good pizza. It's cheap, gets warmed in the oven, and its crispy. Good NY fashion style pizza. CASH ONLY.
author: Mikey F.

description: I was told this was the best ny style slice in the city. Was disappointed.  Just ok as far as pizza goes. Also pricy per slice ($4) and the guy working was grumpy.
author: reza n.

description: My favorite pizza in San Francisco. White mushroom and tomato garlic!
author: Staci D.

description: On my top five pizza list because 1) perfect thin crust crust, crispy pizza, 2) ok price at $4/slice (but you need at least two to get a full stomach), and 3) cool restaurant style. Try it. You can't go wrong. Cash only.
author: Peter C.

description: If you miss a good ol' New York slice, this is your spot. Hands down.
author: Evelyn B.

description:
Simple no-frills eatery serving decently-sized thin crust pizza! When we first arrived at the shop, the pizza looked cold and waxy... But after they threw it into the oven, it came out shiny and delicious. I had the white spinach pizza, which was so cheesy but so good! I only wish the slices were bigger. 

Atmosphere is clean and industrial-looking, and left a little more to be desired. We went in December so they had some cute reindeer decorations on the walls. I was wavering between 3 and 4 stars, but decided to round up because the staff was super friendly and down to earth. 

Clean, reliable, convenient location, and cheap. I'll be back next time I'm craving pizza!
author: Christine L.

description:
As a New Yorker, I tend to be pretty particular about my pizza pies. I want my slices to be thin, crispy, with the right amount of sauce and not too much cheese to top it off just right. I noticed the Pizza Shop one night while I was in the Mission, and both times I thoroughly enjoyed what I got. 

I tried the Meat-O first, which has a nice pepperoni/sausage combo for people who can't get enough of cured meat. The texture was great and I thought the sauce was flavorful but not overpowering at all. Sometimes you eat pizza and feel like the tomato sauce is just some bland, red food coloring, but the Pizza Shop knows how to make their tomatoes do their thang. 

Most recently, I tried the cherry peppers and pesto slice, and I thought the pesto has a good amount of basil (though I wish it had more garlic). The cherry peppers added a nice kick!  The only reason I can't upgrade this place to a 5-starrer is that paying $3-4 for a slice of pizza just still boggles my mind a bit. I better get used to it, though, since I will be back!
author: Keith H.

description:
My co worker from the east coast was raving about this place. She was saying how this is "the NY" style pizza. She even showed me the correct way to eat a NY style pizza. Fold it right in half and eat it!

I bought 2 slices of pizza. A mushroom & pepperoni and cherry pepper & pesto. My favorite out of the 2 would be the mushroom & pepperoni. Each pizza is $4. Totally love the thin crust and super crunchy type of pizza.
author: Kathleen U.

description:
Clean, simple, and delicious. Most pizza by the slice places have a grungy vibe and the pizzas tend to be greasy, fatty, and soggy. Not The Pizza Shop! I came here on a beautiful, sunny day and immediately loved the vibe - bright, airy, and clean. The atmosphere is inviting and the staff are fun, friendly, and welcoming. They've also got the perfect balance of traditional pizza options (cheese, mushroom & olive) with trendier ones (white pizza with ricotta & mushrooms, cherry pepper & pesto) to satisfy the tastebuds of a diverse clientele. 

I had a hard time deciding on a slice but ended up trying the cherry pepper and pesto. I usually enjoy a little bit of chewiness to my pizza crust but I was pleasantly surprised by the crispy crust here. The ratio of ingredients to crust was just right and I love that the peppers had a slight kick. I could taste the freshness of the ingredients, despite the fact that it had been sitting in a glass case. The pesto on the pizza was delicious and the taste of the basil really came through instead of being overpowered by the garlic. 

The whole experience was so great that I am giving it five stars despite the fact that it's cash only (they do have an ATM inside for your convenience). You can be certain that I will be back to sample the other slices really soon!
author: Janjri V.

description: Wow. Great slices and great service. Came here after getting hung up on by a so called popular pizza place in San Francisco and it worked out great.
author: Joey Z.

description: Delicious innovative pizza flavors and friendly staff. :) Especialy the garlic and spinach pizza!
author: Mrinalini K.

description:
No frills, no credit cards, decent size slice, pizza is solid, thin, cheesy, tangy...
Spartan - I don't even remember seeing any drinks...
author: Jeff J.

description: This shit is crap I've been here it's waste the pizza is flat like cardboard customer service is for yuppies
author: Iz F.

description:
Craving NYC style piZza?  Go here.  Bring cash.  Delicious slices all around and they had my personal favorite, Olive and mushroom.

I'll be back here and often!
author: Sanket K.

description: I looked at what was available on the glass display and decided on 2 slices of The Meat pizza (pepperoni and sausage) for lunch. I ate inside since it wasn't busy. I like that the crust isn't thick or burnt. It wasn't overflowing with tomato sauce between the crust and the toppings. It was just right for me and great for $4 a slice. I'll take this over some of the "artisanal pizzas" you'll overpay for around Valencia St.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
This is a two-part review.

1) the pizza is amazing.  my favorites are mushroom/p'roni and the cherry pepper one.  SO GOOD.  nothing fancy, perfectly delicious.  the price is right and the slices are generous.  the only problem is that it's 2 blocks from my house and that is dangerously close.  the will power it takes for me to not have every meal there....gaaaah!

2) a little feel-good story to share.  i went in to inhale 2 quick slices.  a homeless man came in after me and was staring at the display.  the guy (owner?) waved to the homeless man.  i asked the man if he'd like a slice, and he said yes.  i tried to pay for him, but the pizza guy refused to take my money and said it's on the house.  he also knew the man by name and greeted him warmly.  i threw in some cash in the tip jar, and left there with a warm heart and happy belly.  it was a very neighborly and SF moment.  everybody wins!!
author: Aya S.

description:
This is the BEST place to get a pizza in the Mission.  I love their variety and selection choices.  And by the taste of each slice you can tell that they use the best ingredients.  

This is a fast and simple place to have pizza.  You can get it by the slice or a whole pizza.  

Don't let the down to earth environment fool you... it's nice and comfortable, and there are some good, attentive people working here.  

The service is great!

Try it out - you won't regret it!
author: Christiani C.

description:
For a small pizza shop in the Mission, this place was surprisingly delicious!! I was kicking it with a friend that night, and I needed something to nourish my body from all the hard work that day. 

I tried their white spinach, and something with mushrooms. Both slices were very filling, and shockingly NOT TOO OILY. That was always something I didn't like about pizza's was how much oil the cheese would generate on the pie. 

The vibe is very nice, very easy to get in, and get out. It also opens JUST late enough. In comparison with Artichoke pizza in Berkeley, I'd definitely pick Pizza shop over it. The ratio in dough and toppings is PRISTINE.
author: Huy H.

description:
Get up to the counter, and drool over the display case.  
Order, pay and wait for your slice or pie. 

Cherry peppers and pesto = awesome! $4.00

Pepperoni and pineapple = okay. He thought the pineapple was bland. (I wouldn't know, because I ain't eatin' pineapple on my pizza!) $4.00.

Mushroom and olives = good. $4.00.

He thought that the pizza needed more sauce, and I thought the pizza slice was the perfect combination of dough, sauce, and cheese. Thin crust, FTW!

Soda = $2.00.

Prices = cheap. Affordable. Dinner for two was $14.00.  
$3 for a slice of cheese; $4 for a slice of anything else. Tax included. 

Bring cash. Cash only. Bring CASH.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Really great fresh pizza..

You can see the love that goes into these pizzas if you are there in person and watch these guys. , the vibe on the phone and in the shop is laid back.

Loved the meat-Oh! and the special chili-pesto which is so unique and spicy-yummy.

The crust could be thinner and crustier to be  truly perfect pizza. But still , ordered 2 pies which were a fine $ deal, because they were big ... easy handling a half and half topping combo. Figure advertised on the website. 

There appears to be a nice selection of slices if you show up just for that, hard for me to tell if $4 is too much for anything in San Francisco these days. 

All around true NY style.
author: Craig S.

description:
oh. my. god.
stop what you're doing and get your butt to the pizza shop for some slices of heaven. thin thin thin new york style pizza with fresh delicious simple toppings. MIND BLOWING how good this place. i could daydream about this place forever... you can get 'em by the slice or by the box. woot woot!

cash only so bring yo paper
author: Ava F.

description: Heard mission district was the place for good pizza.  It was a long drive, but really good!  Crust was paper thin, but still light and crispy.  Would definitely come again if I lived closer.
author: Jenn M.

description:
Great pizza but this place has inconsistent hours. 

4 stars for the pizza. Great thin crust pizza, crispy crust and great toppings.  

1-2 stars for the unreliable service and unprofessional business practice of randomly closing shop. I have come here many times over the last several years during their posted open hours and they are often CLOSED. Just a few weeks ago they were closed for a couple weeks. Now they are closed Mon., Tues. and Wed. in October. See attached photo for their limited hours, which is not reflected on Yelp. Parking is hard in the area so it is a big disappointment to drive there, look for parking and then find it is CLOSED.
author: D. P.

description: My first time here for lunch, there pizza by the slice are a bomb very low price for a few giant flat size
author: Christopher L.

description: Full disclosure, I am from New Jersey, as are the proprietors, so I was predisposed to like the Pizza Shop. Not only is the pizza New York good, thin, bendable, slices, rich with toppings, but the shop feels like the storefront shops I frequented in New Jersey years ago. Minimalist, not per trend, just per necessary, and yet feels homey and welcome. My favorites are the white pizza with spinach and the pesto with cherry peppers but I don't think you can go wrong here. Such a welcome addition to the 'hood.
author: Sara A.

description: Came down to SF from LA and this place has some of the best pizza I have ever had I couldn't just stop at on slice kept trying the different flavors and 4 bucks a slice it's an amazing deal with a super friendly staff I would come to this place every time I come back to SF
author: Robert C.

description: Thank god - finally, I've discovered a place in San Francisco that makes an unbelievable slice of pizza. Something about the ingredients, the ratio of those ingredients, and a surprisingly satisfying crunch, makes this hands down my favorite slide in San Francisco. Cash only which has stopped me a couple times... Probably for the better!
author: Sarah T.

description: Went to this place years ago when I was down in the Bay Area. I swear I couldn't find this place forever but I finally did and it did not disappoint me. This has to be the best pizza by the slice that I have ever had. I kept it plain with just a slice of cheese pizza because I had actually just eaten a Cuban torta 10 mins earlier down the street lol. This place is excellent. I love how thin and crispy the crust is. If you want to check out good pizza and you are near mission in the Bay Area, stop by this place and you will be glad you did.
author: Thomas R.

description: This is not overpriced, never-crowded place with friendly and helpful staff and great simple pizza. Overall, great one.
author: Adalyn B.

description: This is some of the best NY pizza I've had. Great value on slices to go. Also, great location and super friendly staff.
author: Giselle W.

description:
I know as well as anyone that there's no "we" in pizza, but the slices here are pretty big (enough for one 'normal' person, I think) and if you team up with another person you get a bit of a deal on your slices. 

1 Slice = $4
2 Slices = $7 (tax included)

Inside is clean and the people who work here were super cool and good sports about my honest joke about "not having my sh*t together" when crumpled up cash flew out of my Costanza wallet and when I needed the bathroom key (that has a giant metal spoon attached to it) and joked that they didn't have to worry - "I wouldn't do anything weird with it"... as I slowly shut the door to the bathroom. 

The pizzas are partially pre-made (par-baked crust at least) with set toppings on top and once you order they toast your slice and it's ready in 90-seconds. 

I got a plain cheese pizza because I like when pizza has red sauce on it and no sweet ingredients and a lot of the other pizzas at that time of day seemed to have meat (not on my personal menu), or potentially be white or pesto sauced pizzas, or had peppers and stuff like that. My roomie got a special pizza with pesto and a bunch of sweet peppers and onions and stuff and seemed to like his slice. 

We came during what seemed to be an off-peak hour so I'm sure the selections are more fruitful during normal eating hours- I know I would've been all about the mushroom and black olive pizza had it been in stock during my visit. 

My slice was fine. I live for thin crust but I'm in the small percentage of people who do not like a super crispy crust and this crust was so crispy that when I folded my pizza to eat it, it actually cracked in half, but otherwise was fine and for $3.50 hard to complain.
author: Candice G.

description:
Consistently delicious New York / New Jersey style thin crust pizza. The City has some good slices, but this is THE BEST in this category (if you need to have that explained, go to The Pizza Shop, eat some and compare the model against other places similar you know). 

It has been great to see Tom's success and support of the neighborhood. The crew working there is beyond awesome. It has become difficult to pass by The Pizza Shop and not stop by for - at least - a $3 slice of cheese.

Give it a go. Seriously. Go.
author: Dan D.

description:
Was just okay.
The woman running the place was very nice.
Clean, simple, hipster atmosphere.
Pizza sold by the slice
$3-4 slices of pizza were quite greasy :/
Probably good drunk or stoner food.
Cash only.
Of all the places to eat & pizza places to eat I'm not sure that we'll go back. Maybe to give them a 2nd try.
author: Ashley G.

description: So good. Reminds me of home (guess where). The crust is great, never ever soggy. I like the plain slice,nothing on it but the great sauce and cheese. Love this pizza.
author: barbara r.

description: Always amazing. Perfect crust with just the right load of sauce, cheese and toppings. The consistency of quality is remarkable.
author: Mike S.

description: I've been here a few times and it has been good service  and great pizza at a pretty reasonable price
author: J W.

description: It's $4 (cash only!) for a huge slice, and the crust  has the most amazing crunch. I'm a big fan of thin crust pizza, and this place definitely satisfies my cravings every time. Love love love their spinach and ricotta cheese
author: Ryota RJ A.

description: The closest I've found to a New York slice. Better than the handful of places I've tried in North Beach. Better than the over-priced gourmet pizza joints. If you're from the east coast, this is what you're looking for!
author: Steve S.

description: The Pizza Shop is a solid spot to get Pizza in the Mission, especially if you live on the east part of the neighborhood - in which case I believe it's the only option then, but definitely a good one!  In terms of pricing, it's pretty cheap ($3.50/slice for plain, $4.00/slice for toppings) but it is cash only, so be aware of that before you go.  It's also open slightly later than most spots on 24th street except Wok & Go.  They serve large, New York style slices - overall they're quite good, but they could definitely benefit from more topping options!  For instance, chicken would be hugely appreciated since there's a nontrivial amount of people who eat chicken but not pepperoni/sausage, though the vegetarian slices are quite good as well!  Overall, good spot worth checking out.
author: Curren I.

description:
Great place for a quick slice! I enjoyed my slice of pepperoni and mushroom pizza.  It was heated up quickly, and the service was friendly.

My two feedback points - I wish this place wasn't cash only.  Also, I wish they had a cheese less option (or could have made one quickly) - my husband can't eat cheese, and couldn't partake.
author: Barnali D.

description: This place has become one of the better spots in SF. I put it 1 step down from Arinels and Tonys and equal to Red Sea Market --less known spot that also does East Coast pizza well. Red Sea has what this place is missing and vice versa.
author: H K.

description: This is the best pizza I've had since moving here from the east coast. Finally, somebody understands what a white pie is! I've tried so many spots in both SF and the East Bay and was giving up hope. If you're from the NYC area and miss what real pizza is, PLEASE come by this spot and grab a couple slices. It will make you miss home a little bit less.
author: Nicholas T.

description:
There are times I like simple, especially if I know what I want to eat and don't want to waste time with lots of options.  The Pizza Shop is that kind of place.  If I want pizza, I know this is the place to go.  The slices are huge and priced right, $3 for cheese, $4 for the ones with toppings.  I'm here often when I need a quick pizza slice fix, or if I need to get lunch for my super picky son, who loves their cheese pizza.  I like their white spinach or white mushroom myself.  Their all meat one is a family favorite.  Heck, I think I tried all their house slices and can't think of anything wrong with them.

Cash only here so bring your bucks.  They'll heat it up for you so you get that nice crisp thin crust.  Again, simple and easy.  This is the way to go!
author: Maria S.

description: This place has awesome pizza! It's thin crust and great quality overall. $3-4 per slice and the slices are nicely sized. They are amazing right out of the oven. It's the perfect amount of crust, cheese, sauce and topping. Not one thing over powers the other and every bite is well balanced. I think the crust is really what does it for me though. Its thin and crisp, but gives you just that little hint of chew that you'd like in dough. The guys are always super nice. CASH only! I did a pick up for work one time and EVERYONE LOVED IT!
author: Krystal T.

description:
While out running errands in the mission, we stopped by The Pizza Shop on a whim to grab a quick bite to eat. The interior is minimal with just one employee and a small display of prepared slices. The prices are what you would expect, with a plain cheese slice coming in a $3. 

I ordered a pepperoni and mushroom slice and I was actually very pleased with how it turned out. The crust was one of the thinnest crusts I've had and it almost had a cracker type of texture to it. The sauce was very light as well which I liked. It could have used a bit more quantity in terms of the toppings though.

Overall, the pizza was affordable, decent quality and very quick. I think this place is "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description:
This is actually 4 star pizza.  The 5th star here is for being in San Francisco!
Don't let the uniform, frankly, boring look of the pies in the display counter put you off.  Once heated up, these slices come off VERY well.
This is Jersey/NY pizza.  Except not quite as dirty.  The owner guy is a New Jersey local and a bit of a hipster, perhaps.  So, what he produces is very well crafted pies that feel clean and almost healthy.
Stick to the plain cheese at first to get a feel of what he's doing here.  It's really quite subtle and awesome!
author: Josh K.

description:
There are pizza shops, and there are Pizza Shops. The former is usually run by a guy named Vinnie who wears a wife-beater and talks like he's auditioning for the part of a pizza guy on "The Sopranos" and still couldn't get the part. I'm thinking of a place like 2 Bros Pizza in NYC where you see all walks of Lower Manhattan life get two big slices and a soda for $2.75. You eat it in the back with all the other goombahs who couldn't get a date that night (photo: http://bit.ly/1qZh2cb). But a Pizza Shop with capital letters must mean there's an unexpected designer element to the culinary creations coming out of the oven, right? Hmmm, not really. Jamie W. and I came here out of curiosity since a pizza spot is an unusual sight among the taquerias on 24th.

It's a modest operation with a large glass case with all their pizza pies on display, a large oven in the back and just four tables for sit-down eating. There were ten to choose from (photo: http://bit.ly/Qc1mHr) , and at $4 a slice, I felt entitled to two. Don't judge me. So I ordered the Pepperoni and Mushroom and the White Mushroom (photo: http://bit.ly/1kZPcPJ). Jamie must have been showing off because he ordered only one slice of the Deluxe, which featured sausage, pepperoni, mushroom, green pepper, onion and olive (photo: http://bit.ly/1hJQsEc). Our verdict? It was OK. The pizza has the cracker-style crust that isn't really my preference, and the ingredients, while fresh, were rather on the bland side as if seasonings were optional. The $2 refillable sodas were helpful to wash them down. Where are my goombahs?

FOOD - 3 stars...middling on the pizza scale, not bad but honestly a bit on the Costco side when it comes to execution
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...could use a bit more oomph to liven up the place
SERVICE - 3 stars...friendly enough
TOTAL - 3 stars...pizza seems more directed to the hipsters than the rest of us
author: Ed U.

description:
4.5 STARS 

After flushing $150 down the toilet at Saru Sushi in Noe Valley, all I wanted to do was to drown my sorrows...

In cheap slice of carblicious pizza.

Me: "I'm still hungry, can we go grab a slice of pizza?"
Mr. NSS: "I'm not, I'll just keep you company."

Me: "You're going to just sit there and watch me eat...like a heffer?" 
Mr. NSS: "Ummm yah, who cares what people think?"

*Arrives at The Pizza Shop*

Me: "Can I get a slice of the White Spinach please?"
Cashier: "Anything else?"

Mr. NSS: "I'll get a slice of the Mushroom and Cheese..."
Me: "I thought you weren't hungry?!?!"

Cashier: "Anything else?"
Me: "Also a bottle of...."
Mr. NSS *cuts me off*: "A slice of Pepperoni and Mushroom too!"

Me: *evil stare*
Mr. NSS: "What? It's for later...you know how I get hungry late at night."

*Pizza slices come out piping hot from the oven: http://bit.ly/1loMFxK*

Me: "Mmmm, so how is it?"
Mr. NSS *while mouth is full*: "Mmmmkaaay."

Me: "Uhh you have an accordion of cheese hanging from the corner of your mouth."
Mr. NSS *no response and moves on to his second slice*

Mr. NSS: "Just so you know, I'm only eating this second slice because it will be cold later."
Me: "Uh huh..."

Mr. NSS *licking his fingers*: "How come we didn't order a whole pizza?"
Me: "WTF!?!"

Men.

OTHER NOTES:
*Across from Philz Coffee.
*Friendly and upbeat staff.
*Excellent pre-made NY style pizzas.
*8 varieties: cheese, white spinach, pesto, pepperoni, mushroom, tomato-garlic, meat-o (pepperoni, sausage & meatball, and combo.
*$3/slice for cheese and $4/slice for all others (whole pizzas available).
*Super crunchy, thin-crust pizzas that are deliciously satisfying and not too salty or greasy.
*Didn't taste any garlic in the White Spinach (-.5 stars).
*Sodas only.
*Four 4-top tables.
*Cash only (prices include tax).
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
CASH ONLY.  Tried out The Pizza Shop in the Mission on 24th St.  They have pre-made pizzas and you can buy a slice for $4.  Cash Only.

Takes a few minutes for it to be re-heated, I got a white pizza spinach.  It was temperature hot when I got it, I dumped a bunch of red chili peppers on it.  Some blobs of ricotta cheese and some spinach on it.  I liked the slice.  Was still hungry after eating it, so go elsewhere or buy another slice.

They have tap water you can help yourself.
author: Ann L.

description: I love white mushroom pizza and the taste of it is so simple but delicious. Excellent!
author: Team M S.

description: Perfect Pizza!  The crust is thin but crispy on the bottom!  Soooo.good.  The topping vary depending on your taste and they offer many varieties.  Don't expect the heavily loaded topping which over power the whole pizza experience.  Clean and quiet little shop.  The staff is helpful and very prompt.  $4 slices and they are big slices.  This pizza shop takes you back to the basics.  Just good old fashion pizza!
author: A A.

description: Believe in pizza again! This place is a rarity in SF: a place where you can grab a slice pizza, eat in peace, and be on your way. A bonus: the guys behind the counter seem to enjoy their jobs.
author: K J.

description: Thanks Yelp. I'm in the Mission from out of town and was craving some pizza. You gave this place a good rating so I stopped here. Delicious pizza slices. Perfect. Two pepperonis and a Coke for $10. I'm a happy girl.
author: Michelle D.

description:
CASH ONLY.

I naively stumbled here and asked for only one slice of cheese pizza. After having one, And experiencing the perfect cheese to sauce to crust crunchy ratios, I ended up with 4 more slices. Having tried pizza in Chicago, New York, and Italy, this is a contender for some of the best cheese pizza I've ever had. 

Highly recommend it!!
author: Amir A.

description: This was my first time to San Francisco, my boyfriend and I stayed down the street and decided to look on yelp for the nearest pizza spot, this place had good reviews so we decided to check it out we walked in and the guy who was running the register/taking orders was probably THE RUDEST person in costumer service Ive ever witnessed/encountered. he was very short dismissive, unhelpful, and in a terrible mood, to not just me but as I sat down and ate i watched and witnessed how he spoke to other guests, every time this guy was asked for something by a guest he acted so foully rude it was ridiculous. Im so mad i didn't catch his name but he has all kinds of tattoos, one being spider man. while he was acting like this the chefs making the pizzas were just shaking their heads at me as if they knew how bad his attitude was. This person either needs to be in the back not dealing with people., or he needs to find another job, i wouldn't want my business to be represented like that. I left with a very bad experience in costumer service.....the pizza however was tasteful.
author: Amanda R.

description:
I love this place, and for some time have considered it the best east coast-style pizza in the city.  But wow, today called for pick-up and got this rude new guy (usually always cool people) which, fine.  But got the pizza - mushrooms & onions - home to find they used *yellow* onions on the pie.  Who the fuck does that???  I picked out as many as I could and was still left with a fermented/caramelized piece-of-furniture tasting shit wheel.  If you're out of white onions, say so!

edit: knocking this down to 1 star, that was fucking horrible.  I gargled with bleach yet still taste the violation
author: Matt B.

description: This is hands down one of the best pizza in SF. The taste was amazing and fresh. Also the texture was perfect. Soft cheese on top and crispy on the bottom. Most places claim they are NY pizza and cannot do this right or at all, but this place has every right to claim. I've been to quite a few pizza spots in SF and hands down this beats them all by a mile. As for the types of pizza, if you like spicy get the pesto and if you like veggies get the Julian. Staff was friendly, service was quick, and pizza was fresh. I highly recommend this place. Parking can be tough but can be found.
author: Ken P.

description:
Clean, simple and quick pizza by the slice operation here.  There's options for whole pizzas as well.  Thin crust style which help reduce my guilty carb intake.  Toasted to be lightly crispy and chewy at the same time.  Taste? very good!

CASH ONLY.
author: Leland H.

description: Pizza is delicious (NY style!) but I called ahead and asked how many a pie serves.  Was told 3 or maybe 4 if you double slice it. The pies are huge!  One pie will serve 5-6 regular folks.  I ordered two for four eaters and have a pie and almost a half left!  But great addition to the pizza scene.
author: Barbara M.

description: You can buy pizza by the slice here and they have plenty to choose from. It's also possible to buy a whole pie but I wouldn't recommend that unless you are one extremely hungry person or a group.
author: Juelz H.

description:
A quick slice of pie:

You'll have to shell out some dough, but the taste, texture and service is worth it although the decor screams "new industrial" while outside is one of the most visibly cultural streets in SF.

The story:

I dropped into this place with my girlfriend the hour it opened, but it was far from a coincidence. I have been walking past it's location for several months now waiting and hoping that I would finally have a neighborhood pizza place to lean on when all the Latin food got to be too much.

Upon ordering three to share the 4$ per piece prices did indeed "slice" at the wallet a bit. Even for SF, four bucks a slice is the top of the range for pizza that's been sitting in a case for who knows how long. I've got half a dozen examples (favorites being in Castro and the Lower Haight) of places that make custom slices on-demand for less than that. But that's the only thing I can possibly complain about.

Because this is damn good thin crust pizza that you can fold and devour like a pre-pubescent boy who has no idea he's going to gain thirty pounds in the next year. Or at least that's why I was immediately reminded of upon the end of my feast: being eleven years old in NY at the deli two blocks from my house, completely unaware that I was heading into a journey that would change me forever. 

Puberty made my pants tight in two ways, and I've only figured out how to stop one of them: diet and exercise. I've given up on the other one.

But pizza! It's good. They're nice. It's clean as all hell and and maybe kinda reminiscent of a meat locker without the meat given the industrial feeling greys and metal. Not a bad design in general and maybe they're still working on it, but it's different than what you'd expect from a lot of 24th street spots. I'm not screaming gentrification here but it's certainly catering towards a specific crowd. Such is life I suppose, and at least they're doing Pizza right.
author: Sean K.

description: The best pizza in all of SF.  Thin crust, not floppy, no burned bubbles that make you feel like you've gotten ripped off.  Friendly staff. Clean. I can't tell you how much I love this place.
author: B W.

description:
This is the best pizza in the mission. Lived in the neighborhood for a few years now and happy to have such a perfect pizza destination. 

Great people, great pizza, great times. 

Go here!
author: Tom T.

description:
3.5 stars 

All my favorite pizzas have a couple things in common, obviously the principal factor being taste. Not having to fold a slice also ranks really high when I consider what makes a delicious slice; whether this has to do with a substantial crust or my preference for avoiding obscenely large triangles of deliciousness, something about having to fold my pizza in half takes away from my overall enjoyment of eating my (current) favorite food. 

At The Pizza Shop, a slice topped with my usual duo, olives & mushrooms ($4), was readily available to be heated up & served, hence the half star. Wasn't the easiest to-go slice to transport, what with being placed on a paper plate & in a bag rather than in a box & all, but I managed & was satisfied with the taste of my first bite. However, the floppy crust buckled under the weight of a sprinkling of toppings & cheese, making it awkward to eat, & reinforcing why I really hate pizza slices that require folding before I can properly chow down.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Excellent PIzza but I don't know why they don't sell beer or other drinks? Very lowkey place with delicious pizza. 
I got the mushroom and cheese pizza and the dough and crust were to die for. Really good pizza for a great place for those that want a quick eat. I will definitely be back for more.
author: Eric S.

description: I come to this place way more than I'd like to admit. The pizza is really great and it's fresh (you can see someone making it pretty much at all times). They will heat it up for you in the oven if you want (although it tastes great cold, too). It costs $4 for any slice ($3 for cheese pizza) and they are pretty good sizes. They only pain point is that they only accept cash (there's an ATM in the shop though). My favorite is pepperoni mushroom, although the cheese pizza is really good too.
author: Kasia R.

description: We ordered 12 pies for kids party with parents. Kids loved it. Parents did, too. The order was on-time and hot and the gentlement could not have been nicer in helping us get the pizzas to the car. We will be back.
author: Seth B.

description:
True NY pizza has arrived.  And I don't mean good pizza that comes close to NY (love you Arinell's).  This *IS* NY pizza. Thin, crisp crust; the right amount of sauce; chewy cheese and just that perfect amount of oil to dip the outside crust into before diving into the slice.  (I'm a bit strange in that I like to eat my pizza backwards from crust down to the tip).

Great customer service, clean eating area and bathroom, everything is compostable!!!

Hope this one sticks around for a long time!
author: R A.

description:
The Pizza Shop specializes in New York-style thin pizza, which can be good for those looking for something quick n' easy. 

One thing I like about this place is how thin and crunchy each of the slices is. It's almost like eating a pizza cracker. It's not too greasy either, which is definitely a plus.

Environment is kind of sterile, but it's the food that counts.
author: Casey S.

description: THEY REALLY HIT THE MARK!  The combination of the right heat, the right amount if dough, and the correct ingredients and these guys nailed it.  It's great pizza, and I eat a lot of pizza
author: M. R.

description:
Finally I can write a review for that awesome place!
I was in SF a few weeks ago and craving pizza. And let me tell you, I was not disappointed. In fact,you wouldn't necessarily think it, it might be the best pizza I've ever had. It was crispy but cheesy at the same time  and just tasted awesome. I didn't expect that at all and was really surprised. 
I didn't have yelp til now,find that shop through a friend,but I couldn't stop thinking about writing a review cause these guys really deserve it. Oh and the staff was super cool and nice too!
Trust a pizza lover (I have a  tattoo) and go to that place if you're in SF!
author: Jenny E.

description:
By FAR the best slice in SF.  Not sure when you get a lot of stuff on it, I just get plain or maybe with pepperoni.  NY style crust done right.  Personally I might up the sauce to cheese ratio a tad, but I don't want to get picky.  I want this place to thrive and then open a branch right around the corner from where I live.

Also every time I've been in, the folks behind the counter have been super nice and friendly. I'm one of those yelpers who usually only writes a review when someone has pissed me off and I want to warn folks away.  Thought for a change of pace I would lend my voice of support for a business I can rave about.   So happy this place came to town, only hope the quality keeps up as they get busier and have other folks actually making the pies.

Just got back to town, and so looking forward to my next slice at the Pizza Shop.
author: Art B.

description:
I came here at the request of Serious Eats, and I was pretty pleased! 

It is a very traditional slice house! About only 4-5 tables, seems like most of their business is slices to go! I actually enjoyed my cheese slice the most, and my motto is - if you can't make a good slice of cheese pizza, I don't really care what toppings you bring to the table. 

They've got the cheese pie nailed people - so give them a shot and try their other creations :)
author: Sam A.

description:
the legit way to eat NY style pizza is to fold it in half, hold it in your hand like a taco and chow down. You know, like in the opening credits of Louie. There should also be a small pool of grease in the middle. If you use a napkin to absorb the grease and dab at your pizza disgustingly, then you aren't worthy of pizza. 

Pizza Shop offers pre-made, NY style pizzas by the slice. You can pre-order a whole pie if you like. Your slice is reheated before served to you. If you luck out and a pie is coming fresh out of the oven when you're ordering, then go for THAT one. This place is pretty bare bones and it is small. 

I had a slice of the white spinach because my tomato food allergy was still raging in full force back then. It was good, but I need to try all of them methinks. No little pool of grease for me since I had white spinach. It was still tasty, but a bit on the dry side. A slice got me pretty full because I ate the crust and everything (which I normally don't do) and at $4 a slice, you can't go wrong.

ca$h only!
author: Susy C.

description:
Great pizza, great people, great price - they came in early just to help make plenty of pizza for our son's birthday ...  If you want to order a lot of pizza for gathering, consider picking up from here for sure!  

(Not set up to be a destination for eating ... no delivery ... but worth the trip!)
author: Alexandre P.

description:
If you see 4 star reviews for this place, it means it is perhaps morally difficult for some people to give five stars to what is basically a pizza stand. Fair enough. But make no mistake--there is no pizza stand in San Francisco better than this. Golden Boy is different, but as good. But for a thin NY slice, this is the place. FIVE STARS.

If they delivered, they would be millionaires. As it is, you gotta walk to them.
author: Girlie G.

description: Mhmmm my favorite style of pizza. I had a slice of the white mushroom pizza and I loved how such simple ingredients could make such a delicious slice. Maybe it tasted extra good because my date and I were drinking but I let him try mine and he loved it as well. I'd love to come back and try different slices. At $4 for a decent sized slice, they're prices you'd expect for SF. My date liked his pepperoni and mushroom one as well.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Pretty nice pizza joint in the heart of the mission. 
The pizza slices are always quite fresh, although a bit greasy at times, and have a nice thin and crispy texture, just the way I like my slices. The slices are also relatively cheap since they're just around $3-$4. Unfortunately though, they only accept cash, so be sure to have some on hand.
author: Sahil S.

description:
+1 for keeping the doors open as me and the boyfriend rushed here at 9:55pm for a late snack. 

I liked the thin chewy yet crispy crust, and it didn't seem weighed down by too much cheese. Otherwise, I didn't find the pizza that exceptional. It's fast and you can't really beat $4 for a slice.
author: Xinxin W.

description:
Solid New York Style Pizza

First off the pizza is Neapolitan style thin crust that is like traditional NY pizza. The crust is crispy, the tomato sauce is tasty and the cheese is gooey.  There are all traditional toppings and you can order by the slice. 

They are a cash only business but reasonably priced for SF. $10 gets you two slices and a soda. 

The owner works there most of the time.  A very friendly local experiences.  

I really like the place and am happy they moved in. I wish they stayed open later.
author: Dennis M.

description:
Pizza Shop doesn't have it's hours posted yet cuz it's in "soft opening" plans to open 7 days once they are up to staff. meanwhile 6 days for now.

pizza slices labeled, available in front display counter, cheese (3), with toppings (4)

eats: white spinach slice (4, no tax)
-spinach, mozzarella, ricotta, garlic, parmesan
everything fresh, flavor tasty but not fav
crust  nice and crunchy like brick oven done.
4.5 stars

crumbs:
-question of toppings, maybe mushrooms my fav...
-warm up takes just minutes
-couple tables for sitdown.
-fast, friendly service
author: Victor G.

description:
This is some bomb ass pizza and it's 3 blocks from my house! It's worth running 5 miles for so you can burn off the cals or eating salads the rest of the week as compensation.

We got the meat slice (had pepperoni and sausage), pesto and spicy cherry tomatoes, and a white pizza. All three were incredibyl tasty. The right amount of thin...thin enough so all the flavors popped in your mouth but sturdy enough to hold in your hands! Not too greasy either...I'm under the weather with a sore throat and had no coughing attacks after eating! Yipee!

You know this place is awesome when you ask the employees if they eat pizza every day and they say at least three slices!!!
author: Michelle N.

description:
We all have our favorite Pizza - mine is NY/NJ style thin crust.  After years and years of chasing the dragon - my ship has finally come in.  And that ship is The Pizza Shop.

Briefly, just to quantify how maniacal I am about this pizza style, I have contracted friends and friends of friends in order to get pizza from the East Coast.  I have been known to offer money and pizza to have people fly out with slices from Rudy's in Closter, NJ - one of the best.  

My favorite West Coast NJ style pizza is in Olympia, Washington - and yes, i have showed up there with rolls of plastic wrap and aluminum foil, ordered two slice pies, wrapped each individual piece and shuttled them home to my freezer - rationing them out on special occasions, topping them with anchovy after reheating them in the oven.

Well, now, I am pleased to announce I don't have to go to such extremes anymore!  I can get what I need very close to home.

Like Jesse S. who created a Yelp account just to give this team of two hardworking individuals credit for work well done, I join steadfastly to say thanks to The Pizza Shop for providing such an accurate rendition of deliciousness to my palate.

The thin crispy crust is incredibly crispy and works well when reheated into slices.  The sauce to cheese ratio is spot on.  The slice offerings are real NJ- as many white pizza slice choices as sauced.  Really incredible.  I really like the veggie slice, and given that I tend towards being a carnivore - this slice is solid.

I could go on with accolades, but you get the idea.  The pricing structure is solid.  Other's stingy complaints that this is expensive pizza - duh - quality product made with the utmost attention - is worth the money.  You don't like it - go buy inferior product, then.

I'm leaving now - to go down there and get a slice, yo!
author: Kevin M.

description:
One of the closest things to NY pizza I've had yet. Great variety from plain to pepperoni to white mushroom ( I counted 12 variety options ).

Staff is very friendly and service is New York quick . Cash only so keep those credit cards at home.

As for right now pricing is pretty simple. $3 for cheese, $4 for everything else. Gotta love it!
author: Samuel C.

description: Wow...!!! That's all I can say. They said I won't be disappointed , wow .. Delicious !! Thanks
author: Julian C.

description: Mmm pizza. This is my stop for comfort pizza. The thin crust slices here are absolutely delicious, and the crust is the perfect combination of crispy and thin. I stick to the pepperoni and cheese pizzas (boring, I know I know) but they do everything well and it's totally affordable. There isn't much seating here, but if I wait patiently I've always been rewarded with a table opening up. Their hours have been shortened recently while they get another pizza chef, and I can't wait until they do. Going between Thursday and Sunday is fine, but definitely not enough of the pizza shop for me!
author: Nikhil S.

description:
I may have waited across the street at Philz Coffee shop for nearly two hours waiting for The Pizza Shop to open (good things for good coffee and wifi). I was in town for work and my neighbor (in Minneapolis) had highly recommended it, so I couldn't pass it up when I was so close. When I showed up, there was already a short line of locals waiting to pick up whole pies to go and others stopping in for a quick slice, so I knew I was in the right spot! 

It's "just" really. good. pizza. Incredible crust if you like thin NY-style pizza! It took me right back to one of my favorite pizza places in the Big Apple. One slice isn't enough to fill you up - unless you're just looking for a snack to tie you over - which is just fine because it's so delicious and they have a wide enough variety of options that you won't want just one kind anyway! Don't pass it up. And, if they aren't open yet, just hang out across the street at the coffee shop like I did. :)
author: Carrie W.

description: The slices of pizza here are of quality and very delicious! My favorite is the white mushroom with ricotta cheese. The crust is nice and thin and crispy! Definitely worth trying. Don't forget to bring cash.
author: Couture A.

description: Get a credit card machine. Really who doesn't accept credit cards nowadays? Especially a new restaurant. Come on!
author: William C.

description:
It's pretty good pizza. My recommendation is to try having it just after noon, when they first open. It's fresh out of the oven then, and the most flavorful.
