The reason I really like this place is that it's only $4/slice, making for a pretty cheap lunch. Cheap and good, that's pretty ideal, right?
author: Kristine K.

description: CASH ONLY. This is a cute little spot in a partially ghetto spot of SF. Pizza slices are $4 each. My favorite was the cherry pepper and pesto. The meat, pepperoni and white and mushroom were good as well. I like the dough. Pizza dough is kneaded and handmade. You can taste the difference. Yummy!
author: Christanne C.

description: I finally found the crispy and foldable crust I've been craving! This is the best NY style pizza I've found in the Bay Area and I'm in love. I prefer the classic cheese pizza, it's perfection. My only wish is that I moved next door or they offered delivery.
author: Andrea B.

description:
UMM this hit the SPOT! We came near closing time but were able to get our NY style pizza fix. I got the classic pepperoni and mushroom and my friend just got the mushroom pizza. I devoured it and the service was quick. I like how crispy all the bread gets when the heat it -- I know that's not for everyone but I prefer it that way. They seem to have a simple menu but I kind of like that in a small pizza shop. I also wish they were open later-- it would be awesome to stop by a place like this after a long late night out. They are new so maybe they'll expand their menu/hours as they gain popularity. One thing to take caution is that it is cash only; it's $4/slice. You can also opt for a whole pizza obviously.

The ingredients taste fresh and it's a personal plus that every product they offer is compostable (plate ware and cups, etc.) and the location is small but super clean and minimalist in ambiance. Perfect for a quick pizza pit stop in the Mission district.
author: Janelle S.

description:
Had moved to San Francisco from New York, I often shrugged when my friends would hand me a horrible slice of pizza on a paper plate. "How dare they," I thought as I made my way to the crust. "This is a disappointment, and I'm a disappointment for eating this." A lazy pizza was all it took to ruin a day, regardless of the beautiful and warm February bay-area weather. I'd rather freeze my apples off in New York City if that meant the possibility of warming up to a proper slice of pizza accompanied with a glass of beer. Oh man, those were the days.

However, it was this thought that lead me to walk hangery in 24th street. My inner pizza monster had wrapped it's cheesy arms around my throat, and it was demanding I consume a slice of pizza. Turning my head like a paranoid crack addict, I stumbled upon a sign that read "Believe in pizza again." It was written in chalk, and it was written in script. It was beautiful, and I took a leap of faith and walked through the entrance.

"Cheese pizza...please" I growled. "And a pepperoni while you're at it." The cashier responded with a smile, and traded my crumpled $20 bill with a crisp Hamilton and a couple of Washington's. 

Time on the table passed quickly and the cashier greeted me with two slices of pizza. 

"Enjoy."
"Thanks."

I took a bite. And another bite. And then another. I couldn't believe it. My inner whiny 5-year-old kept his mouth shut. Instead, he was happy. Very very happy. After a short demolishing session, I glanced down to my paper plate and saw that there were nothing but crumbs left. Strange, I never eat the crust.

I got up in a mild panic and ordered another slice, this time "The Meat." It was 8PM, and I wished the day had just started. After a second demolishing session, I twirled my thumb, hoping another slice would magically appear, but I needed to save what was left in my wallet for the fare back home.

Maybe it was my intense craving for a proper slice of pizza, or maybe I was sleep deprived. But I left the The Pizza Shop smiling, believing.
author: Ken W.

description:
Amazing Pizza!!! Lets just say, coming from someone whose had authentic Pizza in Italy , this is sooooooo good, I actually crave this pizza any day over the ones Ive tried in Rome. This is as good as it gets. MINUS one star only because its CASH ONLY. please change this!!!! 

The pizza is light, thin crunchy crust, and the cheese just melts in your mouth!!!
author: Christina M.

description:
Since moving from New Haven, CT a year ago I've been looking for pizza-by-the-slice that comes even close to what you can get out east. The Pizza Shop is the first place I've been to that hits the mark. Awesome pizza, simple toppings, nice atmosphere. 

Would be nice if there were larger tables that could be shared, since we had to stand and eat our pizza.
author: Jake I.

description:
Updated to 5 stars because I'm addicted.

The pies with the tomato sauce on them really hit the spot. If you want filling delicious, cheap, quick dinner, this is the spot. I think it's the best thin crust pizza I've had. The environment is also not too skeezy like a lot of pizza places can be.

Not as big of a fan of the pesto/white pies. I once had one with parmesan cheese on top that was just a little too heavy for a pizza. And toppings are a bit sparse. The cheese is the star of the show with these pizzas.

Plain cheese ($3) or sausage ($4) is the way to go!
author: Mila K.

description:
So, we are hungry. Driving down 24th St. What to eat...what to eat? Mexican, nah... Deli Sandwiches, nah...Chinese, nah. PIZZA, yeah!! Where to now? oh, wait look at that place in the "almost" corner. Let's check it:

Super Clean
Cash Only
Open Airy and smellin good! 

I'll take a White Spinach, please and a Meat-o! The crust was nice and crunchy just the way I like it. I've been to the East Coast and had pizza similar pizza. One of my other favorites it came close to is Bronx Pizza in San Diego.  

I am a fan and will be back for more PIE!
author: Carla F.

description: I was honestly surprised as to how much I enjoyed my slice of pizza! Simple, solid flavors, and thin crispy crust. Not greasy at all! Will definitely be back!!
author: Marcia M.

description: Best pizza i have ever had! The mushrrom white and the mushroom olive are my favorites! All the staff are super friendly too except for this one hipster chick that works the counter sometimes, shes rude. BEST PIZZA!!!
author: Hillary S.

description: This was by far the best NY style pizza I've had in the Bay Area.  Being a native of NY/NJ, I grew up with amazing pizza and just haven't been able to find it here.  Well, the search is over!  Thin, crispy crust with just the right amount of chewiness, perfect sauce and cheese, it felt like I was back home.  Amazing!
author: Bart M.

description: Delicious new addition to the pizza train. Thin crust, just a few ingredient choices (which all look good, by the way).  I tried a hot pepper and pesto slice, which was awesome. Highly recommend.
author: Amber K.

description:
We needed a good slice shop in this neighborhood and this is it. The owners and the people who work there are genuinely friendly and the pizza good ny style. Firmer than some, and less greasy, which i like. The sooner you start eating it, the better. 
They do a delicious range of toppings and whole pies as well. 

This is a little example of why SF is so great; you can get good versions of all kinds of food styles here.
author: Charlie H.

description:
My friend and I came to check this place out after reading an article on seriouseats.com that dubbed this place "The Best [Slice] In The Mission." Deep in the heart of the Mission, it's a little challenging to find a parking space, which may explain why so many people came into the shop with their bicycles in tow. The pizzas are all on display in a case right when you walk in, including a "Pie of the Moment" which I presume is their special. We ordered a slice of The Meats, the spinach ricotta, and the PotM which was a ricotta and cherry pepper pizza.

The Meats: solid if unspectacular. It's as clean a meat slice as you'll come across, not heavy on the pepperoni grease but also not overwhelming with the heavy Italian sausage flavoring that I enjoy. Also, they use a minimal amount of sauce, which I guess is a matter of personal preference.

Ricotta spinach: the white part of the pizza (aka most of the pizza) is a little underseasoned, but the spinach is definitely like "HELLO you are now eating spinach!" which I really enjoyed, because you're supposed to actually taste the toppings (unlike the nondescript spinach I've had on other pies in the past).

PotM: again, another white slice but with spicy cherry peppers. Unfortunately the least memorable slice of the 3, thus giving an altogether different meaning to "of the moment".

Their pizza is baked with minimal char on the bottom, which is a huge plus since I hate eating pies that are burnt on the base. The base is fairly crisp with decent chew, which is nice when you're eating the thin cheese-covered parts of the pie; however, the crust is exact opposite of pliable and is very reminiscent of eating a dry cracker and therefore sadly discarded. 

Overall I can see why the Pizza Shop is a local favorite (bonus points for serving both root beer and Cherry Coke) and the staff is super friendly, but maybe I attribute a little more..."grease" to what I'm looking for in my ideal slice.
author: Gene C.

description:
I was making my usual run at philz coffee/sidewalk juice when I noticed this little shop right next to my juice spot that I never noticed before. Food was definitely on my mind after I got my beverage, but I wasn't looking for anything too heavy for a meal. The street sign in front read, "believe in pizza again" and, "hot in 90 seconds." Thin slices of pizza that's ready quick was enticing enough to bring me in and I didn't even know that "I stopped believing in pizza." The glass display case when you walk in shows about 12 different combinations of pizzas but be forewarned the pizza unheated didn't look too appealing. Not like how blondie's pizza displays their hot pizzas, but I was willing to give this new place a try especially with that sidewalk tag line. 

The pizza came out hot and fast after being heated up. I took my first bite of my pepperoni mushroom slice and the pizza had a nice balance of crust to cheese topping. My favorite thing about the pizza was the crunch of the thin crust. Overall, I was pretty pleased with my experience here. 

The only con to this place is; cash only and that my two topping slice was $4 for a slice that disappeared way too quickly.
author: Limuel G.

description: Good pizza but the absolute worst schedule. The place is closed about half the time.  Changes from week to week, odd hours that they decide to change on a whim.  How are people supposed to predict when you are open?
author: Shannon N.

description:
The Pizza Shop is consistently awesome at slices of thin-crust pizza. My favorite is the white mushroom or white spinach (spinach, mozzarella, ricotta, garlic, Parmesan), both $4 and incredible. The folks there are nice.

There isn't too much seating, but I haven't had trouble finding a place to sit when I don't get a slice to go.

I'd recommend getting slices, because they reheat the pizza for you, and it's warm and crisp and amazing! 
I've also ordered a pizza to go, but the delay between us picking it up, it had cooled down and wasn't quite as crunchy as it is in the shop.
author: Jessica S.

description: I noticed this place since last year. I am so happy there is a pizza place like this in the Mission. It's cash only and does not have delivery service. The pizza is incredibly good. Highly recommended and already have.
author: C G.

description: The overall concept is simplicity. I can appreciate that. And I'm happy to support a local business :)
author: Vivek N.

description: After the second day of the three day February CA Bar Exam I was tired! I was also stressed out and looking for comfort food. This place hit the spot. best pizza! It was empty when I walked in but soon after sitting down the locals started coming in droves. The place would empty and then another rush. So if it looks empty go in get a slice and you can't go wrong with the pesto. Also, the cheese and pepper shakers were at a station... Don't grab the shakers and hog them like I did.
author: Michael A.

description: Ingredients are on point! Had "The Meat" perfection! Not to mention the bathroom was beautiful and squeaky clean. Great customer service. We will return.
author: Tynesha B.

description: Large slices, quick service, good flavors, and perfect crust thickness (in my personal opinion)  I'll be back soon
author: Sophia B.

description: Mmmmmm! So good. Yummy crust. Simple, clean, cute. The young man taking orders and cleaning is very nice and friendly!
author: Allysyn O.

description: I appreciate all styles of pizza, and this place really nails thin crust. The crust is always nice and crispy, and it has the right amount of cheese and sauce. I recommend any of the pizzas with peppers, they really add flavor. You might think $4 is a bit steep for a slice of pizza, until you see the size of these slices - well worth the price. Service has been quick and friendly both times I visited, but remember to bring cash.
author: Stephen B.

description: Made me feel like I was back in Jersey. Nice thin crust. Cheese dripping that amber oily deliciousness that you pour off onto your plate. It felt like home. Nice people seem to run it. I'll be back!
author: steve m.

description:
Pizza is a bit too expensive here. $4 a slice! The pizza is pretty good though and has more flavor than most. It's not just cheese melted on bread. The crust and bread of the Pizza is really well done and delicious. Also, came hot right out the oven which was great.

Try it!
author: Anonymous ?.

description: Bets pizza in the city. They are on the monthly cycle. One of my family's favorites!
author: Jason M.

description: Great no-nonsense thin crust pizza! The service is friendly, the place is squeaky clean and there's plenty of room to sit down. They have free tap water which I always think is a nice bit of service to the customers who don't want a soda or bottled water. The pizza selection isn't really wide: they stick to about 8-10 classics, so you might be disappointed if you're into some more exotic pizzas. Otherwise, this is a great spot for thin crust deliciousness!
author: Marin L.

description: Thin, crispy and delicious pizza. If you arrive in the last 30 minutes, they will probably only make it to go. Which is fair.
author: Wellington M.

description: Amazing, can't say anymore.. Authentic pizza
author: James S.

description: Best pizza in SF. Better than Tony's. The pizza is the closest thing you'll get to east coast pizza. Everyone is super nice. Cash only. Sometimes they don't keep consistent hours.
author: Jennifer B.

description: For a small place that doesn't look like much, their pizza is great. I especially like theur variations of white sauce and/or spinach but they also have classics like pepperoni for those of you who just want a normal slice of pizza when you're hungry and in the area. It's not somewhere I would drive all the way over to if you're not from the area but worth the price whrn you're already hanging around.
author: Stephanie R.

description: This is one of my more favorite pizza joints in the area. Great for a grab and go slice. It's worth it, but they are a bit pricey at $4/slice. The ingredients are high quality and I particularly like the pepperoni and mushroom slice. There really isn't much else to say except The Pizza Shop is definitely worth a visit!
author: Victoria J.

description: Love love love!  Pizza slices in a variety of great toppings. Go with a bunch of people, and everyone can have exactly what they want. The owners seem to always be there, and they're very, very nice. This is the perfect pizza place.  The only room for improvement would be adding beer to the menu.
author: John D.

description: Solid pizza shop in SF! $3 for cheese slice and + $1 for all other slices is the best deal going for the perfect quick bite. Hours are a little funky, but otherwise, a definite Mission drool-worthy stop.
author: Grace C.

description:
http://youtu.be/yunwTSfbAyI  

I think the guy from this commercial would approve of this place!
author: Jody B.

description:
In the matter of years, the world of pizza has become quite complex. The complexities are rooted in the desire to either have a cheap pizza (not that flavorful) to an epicurian delight that will charge you 30+ for just a small personal pan pizza. 

While the entire space race round Pizza is something that can be of interest for the many, I'll shy away from that this one time. This place presents nothing, but the best pizza; nothing over the top, and nothing disgusting. 

It is simply just that - the best piza that you have ever tasted... on this coast. :) 

Go here, and go here a lot. It's an amazing scene, the food is impeccable, and you'll be investing in the community.
author: Jane E.

description: Excellent pizza, even to NYer's standards. I wish they sold their dough, and I wish they took credit card (I find it strange to only that they only take cash this day and age).
author: Dana O.

description: I'd actually seen this place several times passing by while I was busy and it looked and smelled great this is the first time I've come here and I swear to you I'm coming back again and again the pizza's taste is like no other, way better than domino's and round table the price seems reasonable in my opinion I definitely absolutely recommended this place to anyone who enjoys pizza
author: Angel S.

description:
I got the artichoke slice and a cherry coke. Perfect dinner. Wait time was short for heating up. The circles of tomato sauce on the slice were so yummy and the toppings tasted really fresh. Love the amount of cheese-to-crust ratio. Their crust is really good especially if you like NY style 'zza. 

Wish they had more veggie varieties of to-go slices, but I do appreciate that they keep it simple. If they added a vegan slice I'd easily give this another star. 

I think this place has a ton of potential and is definitely onto something - go Pizza Shop!
author: Erin W.

description:
Cash only. So worth it! 

So... this might just be because I'm pregnant... but OMG this pizza is amazing! If you are looking for typical delivery type pizza (greasy, thicker crust), this is not the place for you. If you are looking for fresh, delicious, thin crust (but not too thin) pizza, go to the Pizza Shop. I crave their pizza on the regular and have tried so many of their options, I can't pick a favorite! And for someone that likes routine, it's hard for me not to pick a favorite! Love this place, keep doin' what you're doin!
author: Kristen A.

description:
maybe even 3.5 stars.
the crust was way too crunchy. 
had the cheese pizza which was ok. It was too cheesy for my taste.
also had the white mushroom pizza. it was good if you like white pizzas but once again, the crunchy crust.  the whole slice is as if you are eating pizza thats made using pita chips as a base. That's how crunchy it was.

clean inside and the service is good.
$3 for a slice of cheese and $4 for the others.

Fast and friendly service.
Theres maybe 4 tables inside to eat.
Opened for 11 weeks.
author: Heejin L.

description:
okay disclaimer: i'm originally from the east coast, i'm obsessed with pizza, and i'm sick of poor crust-to-topping/sauce ratios. i've been on a quest since i moved here to find the best NY-style pizza in the bay, and this is definitely up there. it's cheap, it's super fast, the people are friendly, and most importantly, it's delicious. i got the white cheese and spinach slice and it was the bomb.com. definitely giving farolito a run for its money as favorite late-night munchies.

reminder - cash only!!
author: Amanda L.

description: Pizza is awesome, thin and crunchy. $3 a slice for cheese, the rest are $4 a slice and $2 per drink. Only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because I don't like having to go to the next table to ask them if their done using the cheese and red pepper so I can get a turn with it, I find it a bit rude and uncomfortable. There should be enough to accommodate each table or at least have single packages to offer your customers. Besides that it's the best pizza I've had so far.
author: Katerin G.

description:
The crust is so thin and so crispy and SO GOOD. 

The white spinach is something I want to eat again and again.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
I created a Yelp account LITERALLY to give The Pizza Shop the best review possible. I live in the neighborhood, and walked by this place tonight, did a double take "what! a new pizza place?" and walked in for a slice even though I had JUST eaten a huge dinner.

I ordered a slice of cheese to test. It was three bucks. THREE. That's how much a cup of stupid coffee costs in this town, and a slice of amazing pizza is so worth it. That slice blew my mind. It melted my face. I mean, I'm serious guys, you've got to try this pizza. The owner/master pizza-maker, Tom, trained for A DECADE at quite possibly the most famous mom-and-pop pizza establishment in the US (Bronx Pizza, San Diego), and he freaking delivers.

After my slice of cheese (which I gleefully consumed in a bar down the street, and not-so-gleefully shared with hungry friends), we walked past The Pizza Shop an hour or so later just at Tom was closing up. He had a few boxes of left-over cold slices from the last batch of pizzas that day - he hooked us all up with slices for free - and now I think I've never been so full or happy in my life. 

I will be going back, bringing all my friends. You should go too. Right away.
author: Jesse S.

description: Blow your mind good pizza. Made from fresh ingredients, pizza made from scratch!! Can NOT get better!!! Well worth any wait! Service is amazing! A great place to grab a slice after a morning at the beach or wondering Jaco!
author: Lindsey D.

description:
First by the slice place in this part of the Mission and thank god they arrived!  I was getting sick of burritos and sandwiches constantly.  I say its 3.5 star slice of pizza.  I am always still hungry after 1 slice and $4 per slice is about $1 higher than I would normally expect since you need 2.  But hey, I can still get lunch for under $10 and get my pizza fix weekly now. 

I bumped them up to 4 stars because I really like the employees working there and I rarely have to wait more than 5 minutes to eat.  I say its worth adding to your routine if you live by 24th.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Shortly after i wrote the first review they changed something in their sauce or cheese, and I would say this is pretty close to a perfect slice of pizza - i didn't say NY slice of pizza because that should just be a given that a perfect slice is a NY slice :)

They only have a few tables so if it's busy you might have to get it to go - or eat it standing up. Also, it's cash only. 

I've basically stopped looking for NY pizza places in san fran now because this place is that good. The only way i can see it being better is if it were closer to my home.
author: Ian L.

description: Cheapest dinner I've had in SF! Devoured my $3 cheese pizza! I'm honestly not a huge pizza lover but this place has changed my mind. I'm so glad I don't live near here or else I'd be frequenting this place often! The crust was so perfect and the cheese did not overpower the pizza at all. For $3 a slice you cant go wrong.
author: Samantha S.

description: Really good. I've never been to nyc so no clue if it's the same.  Tried the meat o and was very satisfied. Really clean and pro show as far as customer service and cleanliness. Go and have a slices.
author: Raylan W.

description:
Like some of the other reviewers, I'm originally from the NJ/NYC area. I was so excited to try this place after reading the reviews claiming it would fill this NJ thin-crust void, and was not disappointed! No longer will I have to get pizza every time I visit the East Coast because it just doesn't exist here (well, to be fair, I think Bernal Heights Pizza does an okay job too).

I got two generous-sized slices of cheese from The Pizza Shop in the early afternoon, grabbed a smoothie next door, and headed over to Precita Park to enjoy them in the sun. They were sooo good, I'm just wondering when I can go back! Service was friendly and quick, and the place wasn't crowded.

I would have liked a sturdier take-out container for slices than putting them on doubled paper plates into a paper bag, but it was okay for the short distance I carried it, and I was glad that they sold slices for take-out to begin with. My only other complaint is that it looks like they don't sell any size pie other than large.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Tell me if this conversation strikes you as odd;

Me: Hi! I live in the neighborhood. First time here. Tell me where to start!
Owner: It's all good. It's more about personal preference
Me: ahh *starring at the case evaluating my choices"
Owner: I say start with the cheese and if you don't like it, you don't have to come back

What what? Did I just get a smack down?

Verdict - my plain cheese was heavy on the cheese. I actually can't taste the sauce underneath the oil. Not a lot of stretch on the cheese.  Crust is thin and very crunchy - could do with more salt. Not foldable. 

Not hating. Not loving. A good alternative in the land of Mexican delights. 

My fave NY style pizza remains my favorite. It's actually found in SF is found in a dive bar - not in a pizza shop - very nearby.
author: Joyce L.

description: Pizza is not too shabby and I haven't had a slice I didn't like from this place but it's not the best in the mission. I did like this place because they stated they were soy free when I asked detail questions but I had an allergic reaction to the pizza, so probably won't be going back. They wouldn't tell me all the ingredients because the recipe is proprietary.
author: Divya P.

description: O.M.G. This place made me believe in pizza again. I usually don't voluntarily eat pizza, but man the tomato garlic pizza is just done RIGHT. I'm getting cravings just thinking about it. I love the minimal thin crust style here. It's flavorful and chewy and just plain delightful. I'm not sure why this place doesn't have a big line out the door because it should! Very casual and clean, with a slightly hipster feel to it. Not your nasty greasy 3AM pizza joint.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I'm from NJ/ NY, and I find the pizza options in the Mission seriously lacking.  Then came along The Pizza Shop and man was I HAPPY!  They do perfectly classic NY style slices and pies, and they do it really well!  It's leaps and bounds better than some of the other new spots on 24th. and better than any of those options near 16th.  This crust is perfectly thin, perfectly chewy with just the right amount of crunch.  HUGE fan, and I hope they do really well.

This is not a Delfina substitute, this is not Neopolitan pie.  This is cheesy greatness that is the unbeatable NY pie.  Highly recommended for those whom care about the perfect crust.  Great for slices, and great for pies to take home.

Thank you PIZZA SHOP!
author: Jon S.

description:
The service was friendly, the pizza was tasty, and the prices were fine.

I ordered the Julian, it was dope. #DopePizza
author: Owen J.

description:
Mind. Blown.

This is a NY street slice, no reservations or qualifications required.

It's not the best NY pizza ever but it is way, way better than any NY slice I've had in SF in the past nine years. Fantastic crust. (My GF and I said that one to each other several times, and we're both ex-NYC.) Good sauce. Maybe a bit heavy on the cheese. Heated up to just-too-hot-to-take-a-bite before being handed to you on a paper plate. Just the right amount of grease leaks out from the fold.

I stopped back in for another slice on my way home.
author: Joshua P.

description: I read about this place in SF Weekly and while it's pretty no frills inside, the most important thing delivers...excellent pizza.  The crust is nice and thin yet crispy at the same time.  A feat that is difficult to accomplish.  I got the special of the day which was cheese and pesto and a meat one as well.  Great spot!
author: Blake B.

description: Great pizza by the slice place.  Good pizza, good price.
author: Emily R.

description:
Felt like popping in for a slice. 

It was a good slice. NYC-style ain't my fave, but this was a good slice.
author: Brent D.

description:
On point! Solid, no fuss tasty slices. My only complaint is that it took you so long to arrive in the hood. 

There's lots of high-brow pizza in this city, some of it worth checking out. But when you want your fix, this place is the jam. Congrats and keep doing what you do. 

Props to the music selection as well, always interested in what the owner has playing when i head in. 

Only suggestion comes from my wife who's an interior designer. She says you should add one more 2-top table to the middle of the store to help fill in the space and give it a little more seating. 

Keep it going!
author: Andreas H.

description: Holy hell, I DO believe in pizza again.  This is the best, most flavorful, fresh, authentic tasting pie I've had in ages.  It's actually better than Arinell's and they had tons of options for vegetarians that weren't just like here's-a-slice-with-broccoli-on-it.  It was actually interesting, so so good, and the people working there appeared to care.  I was astonished.  Fave new afternoon snack place!
author: Monica R.

description: Stumbled upon this place after grabbing a coffee at Philz and tried the tomato and garlic. Fast, simple and delicious.
author: Staci O.

description: The customer service at this pizza shop was horrible. They only take cash, and the man serving me and my friends said we needed to use the atm. Once the atm didn't work, the man was still very rude and insisting that we go down the street and use the other atm. I would not recommend this pizza shop to anyone who expects respect and good service.
author: Megan E.

description: Best pizza in SF hands down if you're looking for thin crust. There may not be the crazy toppings as other places, but you don't have to deal with the long lines. Growing up in New England, I've had plenty of pizza from NYC, New Haven and Boston, and I'm grateful for this slice of east coast in the Mission!
author: Betty H.

description: We had the pleasure of encountering a super snarky crew. They also changed the price of the pie they originally told me over the phone. They have a pretty pathetic personnel imo, but I like their pizza.
author: Sayan S.

description:
The dough is the starting point and the key! 
I there is maybe oil in the dough giving it the extra thing.. I never made pizza 
but there is something there giving more than just flour and water.
They do stretch it thin but all works with a good sauce and cheese. 
CASH ONLY...
author: Frank H.

description: I got a cheese slice, a zucchini/ squash, and a mushroom. Haven't tasted a NY slice this good in SF ever! Perfectly cooked on the bottom and melty crunchy just like it should be!
author: Ivan S.

description:
love is the best word to describe the place
try the candida bacon
author: Erick P.

description:
Wahoo!  Excellent east coast pizza!  I'm so glad this shop opened up near me.  

I don't know what it is that makes this pizza so good, but for 20+ years I've been on the look-out for great pizza in SF and I feel like I've finally found my No. 1 place!  Naturally, there are other pizza places in the Bay Area that I've enjoyed over the years (Delfina, Zachery's, Tomaso's) but usually for their more artisan or deep dish or other styles....and the places I used as examples don't have pizza by the slice.  

I waited to write this review until after eating here three times.  The high quality is consistent.

The Pizza Shop is east coast style comfort pizza - unpretentious, delicious and available by the slice.  Yes, you can also get a whole pie.  Next time your on 24th Street, check 'em out!
author: Ray S.

description: Hands down the best New York style pizza slice in San Francisco, and well worth the $4.  Move over Arinell.
author: Aaron G.

description: My husband is from New Jersey and has lived here in San Francisco for about a decade. He hadn't found acceptable, let alone pizza he was actually excited about since he moved here. The search is over, he found the perfect combination of thin crust, perfect sauce, and cheese flavor and ratio. Well done! This is the best pizza we've found in the Bay Area (East Bay included).
author: Colleen S.

description: Very nice thin sliced. I like mine almost burned and the gal who assisted me heated mine perfectly. One wish there was a place to plug in my phone for a charge. I would pay extra for that convenience. Would recommend offering artisan beverages to accompany the wonderfully crafted pizza. People like healthier alternatives to the typical soda drinks offered in self service dispenser.  Even cucumber, mint and orange flavored water would have been to have as an option. Loved the white mushroom and the pizza of the moment which had thinly sliced jalapeños added - delightful. Nice choice of toppings, for sure.
author: blaine s.

description: The pizza was good....Nothing to write home about. I prefer more sauce and a thicker crust.
author: Taylor C.

description:
Yes. 
This place is legit. I got a 9 slices for 3 people and it was around $33. The slices are huge and pretty tasty. I was absolutely starving and couldn't deal with making dinner for 3 before eating so I made the move and came to the Pizza Shop. Cheese slices are $3 and the other slices are $4. I don't remember seeing any other types of foods but the pizza slices. I felt like their fancy slices (the more than cheese slices) were well thought out. I almost couldn't decide what to get because everything looked tasty and there was a nice variety of options. 
I think what really struck me was the friendliness of the person that helped me while I was ordering pizza and paying for it. It was actually refreshing. I remember thinking about how unique it was to talk to a genuinely friendly person at the register. I feel like I usually encounter people that are too busy sizing me up/being a dick and trying to get dickish with me with an irritatingly fake smile on their face (or just straight stink eye). Those that won't be bothered with civility or having even a shred of humanity. I was happy to /just not/ for once. 
Okay, I digress... Swing by this place and eat. yyuuMMmmmMMMMmm
author: Rachel M.

description: Wanted to grab a quick bite to hold me over until dinner. Light and not greasy with great customer service (a dude walked in and was a dollar short, the girl behind the counter took a dollar out of the tip jar and have him the slice). No hot sauce available (but if you get the "pie of the moment" with cherry peppers then you won't need hot sauce).
author: Shireen K.

description: I always come here for the white spinach, crust is good acts as the perfect support for that cheesy gooey buttery cheese then order a second slice this time get the mushroom and its bomb diggity too! trust me you are gonna want a second slice these people dont play! $4 for a huge slice as in the size of my face! and remember to bring cash! Do not share nor rave about this place to anybody but yourselves... this place is sacred
author: Mara G.

description: I was skeptical about NYC pizza in SF, but this place is incredibly legit. The white pie rivals my favorite E Village haunt (Stromboli on E 7th) and both slices I ate were perfectly crispy, thin crust - nearly impossible to find out here. Believe the hype on this one! Oh yeah, nice minimalist industrial space, too.
author: Janus K.

description:
Tha pizza here is aight. The upside is that they have some cool flavors you don't really see around. It's very odd they just aren't open a couple random days in the week.

The atmosphere in here is kind of weird. It always dark and pretty quiet. Doesn't really make you feel like staying.

The people are really nice!

Slices always come out really quick. Only a couple minutes. Haven't tried ordering a full pizza, though.
author: Jack K.

description:
Excellent Tomato Garlic slice.... sleeper hit here!
Good ingredients and crispy crust along with a friendly staff...
author: Crumbs C.

description: Loved the pizza and nice to see some NJ love there as a Jersey girl. $4 slices are a tad expensive but they are pretty big.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
Mediocre pizza, about average, nothing special to write home about. But they will NOT add toppings of your choice, and there is only one size pie to order. Also, no gluten free or whole wheat options, so hello, get with the times.
Convenient location if you are in the Mission and really craving pizza.
author: Gregg J.

description:
DELICIOUS. 

If you grew up or have lived in NJ or NY, you will LOVE this place!

Pizza Shop, as the name suggests, is a simple, no-frills, cash-only pizza shop that serves greasy and crispy, thin-crust pizza. Thin as in NY Style, not Italian (eg: Beretta). 

Slices are reasonably priced: $3 for cheese while it's $4 for the rest, which include the meat-o (pepperoni and sausage?), white with spinach, garlic/tomato, veggie, pepperoni, and a few other selections. 

The staff is also super friendly. I am SO excited this place is here and that they offer so many tasty looking vegetarian options. I live right across the street and will come by often. Thanks for bringing NJ style pizza to 24th street!
author: Priscilla M.

description: The closest SF has to NY style slices. Great pizza. Wish they had a few more special topping options, but you can always create your own pie. Nice atmosphere too.
author: Allen M.

description: Awesome $3/slice pizza - the crust is so perfectly crunchy! - our new favorite pizza place.
author: Tasha D.

description: really good slice joint. most slices are around $4 of the dollars americain. you can get one of about 5 of the pizza.choices they have in box up.front. good pizza and no winos.at all.
author: Mustapha C.

description: 4.5!  Staple in my life.  I always get the combo togo.  A little price but worth every dollar.
author: Gabriela H.

description: Avid pizza lover visiting from NY and this is good quality stuff. Make sure to get a specialty slice. CASH ONLY
author: Tim D.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday around 7 and got served right away.i ordered a slice of pepperoni with. Ricotta.  It was a ver ry crunchy thin crust pizza. 


The cheese was kinda bland and dry. I'm sure a freshly baked pie would taste better. 

But if you like thin. Crust then this is the place for you.
author: DOM d.

description:
what i ordered... a slice of pepperoni and sausage

pizza was good............... thin crust, a bit chewy, a bit crunchy with enough good tasting sauce and cheese, sausage was minimal but good tasting too and the pepperoni was typical.

ambiance... ok (small with a few chairs and table)
service... godd (guy at the counter was nice and cheerful)
cost... $- (inexpensive)
author: Gors P.

description:
Good place. Good pizza, nice thin, crunchy crust. Great service! 

4 stars because there isn't much variety, but that's just my opinion.

I recommend it.
author: Marianna P.

description: It's an okay pizza idk really know what's the big fuss about it the cheese and the sauce were tasteless but the dough was crunchy and full of air not dough which is a proper way to make a pizza but I had better pizza in the city nothing really that great this about this spot
author: Jhon G.

description:
I agree with the comments that this is the closet to NY-style pizza that you could probably find in SF. The pepperoni/mushroom and plain cheese slices were both delicious - perfect proportion of cheese to sauce. 

My only comment and not necessarily a negative - was that the crust was closer to thin crust than just your typical NY slice. 

Definitely will be returning though!
author: Taylor A.

description: My favorite pizza I've had in the city, even after trying the famed Tony's in North Beach. Took me back to NY, the crust is nice & thin & crisp. I got the white spinach & the pepperoni/ pineapple, both were great. The only thing that would make it better is if they delivered.
author: Mal B.

description: Ok, I'll give it up to the hipsters this time. They have pizza skills inside the The Pizza Shop. I would've given them five stars, but the diarrhea you get from this pizza is an unexpected consequence. Maybe that's why their pizzas (we got three different types) were on the salty side. Ha. The secret is to blend in the immodium INTO the sauce. Happy eating.
author: Michael M.

description:
Yet again I'm visiting a place soon after it opens, and yet again they don't quite have it all put together. No hours are posted - I arrive at 11:50 and shout in "are you going to open today?" To which the pizza maker replies "yeah, maybe at 12 or 12:30." I don't like "maybe" hours. They're still working out the kinks in the ordering process too.

That said, the pizza (which is what really matters) is pretty freaking good. Nice creamy cheese, great flaky crust. No garlic knots like a real NY pizzeria, but still a pretty good approximation of a real NYC pizzeria. I may not trudge all the way out to the Mission just for this, but if I'm in the area again, I'll definitely come back.
author: Marco C.

description:
Grabbed a cold (warm) slice to go. I was starving, and my hubs was coming to pick me up. 

The pepperoni slice was very good, even just warm. $4 a pop puts it on the pricier side. Crust was still crunchy, the flavors were great. It was a really good NY/thin crust.
author: Lani N.

description:
Moved from NY 8 months ago and this is the only place in SF i will eat pizza. 
To say that this place is "NY style" is wrong. The best pizza in the country is in NY, so thats the definition of pizza, its not a style, its just what pizza is. Pizza Shop gets it and it should be the only place you eat pizza from.
author: Jaclyn B.

description:
Such good thin crust pizza. Glad to have this in the neighborhood! Fun vibe, too!

The space is clean and well designed, the staff is friendly, and the pizza keeps me going back for more!
author: Rand F.

description: Wow I am impressed I am a deep dish lover but this crispy thin sliced heaven is just what you need when you want a quick and easy delicious slice. And for 6 bucks with a drink you can not go wrong. They only take cash but worth every penny I highly suggest you take a leap of faith and ask the ladies what they recommend you really can not go wrong. Awesome!
author: Roman R.

description:
We always grab pizza here for office lunches and we are always satisfied! The food is amazing and I even have coworkers who go here weekly for their lunch.

Today we are having a Halloween lunch potluck and two of my coworkers decided they wanted to grab a pizza (everyone is excited!) but our potluck is at 12:30.  They open at 12. I called and left a message in hopes we would be able to order a pizza and be able to grab it in time.

They called back within 5 minutes, were super friendly, and said it would be ready by 12:20!

They are amazing, amazing, amazing! Great customer service! Thank you so much for being yummy and customer focused!
author: Alyssa A.

description: Closest thing to authentic NY pizza in the Bay Area. Cool people too.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Good! Nice friendly staff, clean, fast, delicious. 
This neighborhood sorely needed a pizza place.
author: Tim P.

description: Fantastic pizza at a reasonable price.  If you don't like this pizza then you're not human.  Great variety with a friendly smile.  3 dollar cheese slices,  other topping slices are 4.  Cheese is fantastic as is the lasagna and mushroom slices.  This place is one every pizza place should aspire to.
author: Zach H.

description: Perfect slice shop. Clean, simple, good NY style slices.  $3 for a slice of cheese. That's a good deal for this ridiculous city.  I'm giving 5 stars to help offset these silly 3 star ratings with positive reviews.  "NYC-style not my fav" - well, why did you eat here, knucklehead?
author: Jim J.

description:
Haven't been to this place til now cause it wasn't open when I went. But I got there today and went right in! This place has a good variety of pizza, meat lovers and vegetarians come here! 

Though this place is a bit small it is nice and clean! Not just a hole in the wall, it's a place where they actually make their own pizza and not frozen stuff that is just reheated! 

How to describe the pizza? Well, let's start with the easy stuff..it is delicious!! I had the pesto, white spinach and the artichoke pizza slices. The crust will be perfect to those whom likes thin, crispy, and puffy pizza crusts! And the toppings, albeit more cheese than toppings, is the perfect mixture! Just the right amount of sauce and cheese to bring out the flavor of the toppings! MmmMmm! Come down to this cute place in the mission to eat pizza!
author: linda t.

description: Excellent service, great peices and phenomenal pizza.   Without a doubt the best thin crust I have ever had.  If you are in the area this place is a must.
author: James P.

description: Good pizza per slice, right amount of sauce, cheese and meat. Really tasty , but a bit pricey - $4/slice
author: Tonia I.

description: FUCKING FINALLY.  Arinell's is close, Giorgio's is pretty commendable, and that place on mid-Polk is on the right track, but SOMEONE FINALLY MADE AN EAST COAST SLICE IN SF.  The je-ne-sais-quoi is there!    Now, someone needs to open a real mission-style taqueria in Williamsburg, and the global culinary cycle of gentrification will be complete.  Just like yo' momma.
author: Nick D.

description:
Great slice of pie and good service. Will go out of my way to continue to eat here.
Wish they took credit cards but understand cash only policy.
A very welcome new pizza offering in the city.
author: Mike J.

description:
Thank god for a good pizza place nearby! 

This is no substitute for Delifina or the like, it's just awesome thin crust pizza, perfect for grabbing a slice. It's a super bargain at $3 for a cheese slice, $19 for a pie. 

The people are incredibly nice (even over the phone, imagine!) and the place is cute and minimalist. 

Bummer that they're cash-only and no delivery, but for good pizza I will forgive almost anything.
author: Jillian P.

description: Simple: great pizza, nice people. I was in and out with my hot slices in less than 4 minutes.
author: Madison M.

description: This is my favorite pizza shop. Thin crust, soft, and crunchy, simple with fresh ingredients. Chef is awesome, and makes the crust with super care. I'm not a pizza craze but I can eat two slices. I love the mushroom and pepperoni.
author: Theresa T.

description: I always long for thin crusted, simple ingredients having, unpretentious slices. And finally I've found it. Had the mushroom and pepperoni and another one with all meat. And then I got up and got another one with just cheese. And if I was cow and had 2 stomachs, I'd have probably ate the rest of my gf's 2nd slice but I'm glad we took it home so that I was able to eat it before I went to bed. (There is a gawd)
author: Nick V.

description: This NY style pizza is the best da gum pizza I've had in a long time.  I'm not a fancy pizza guy so I can only comment on the pepperoni but it's got just the right amount of grease and is very crispy for NY style. The crust is awesome, tastes like a breadstick but not overly seasoned like some places that are trying too hard.
author: Brodie G.

description: I'm from New Jersey and the overwhelming happiness mixed with nostalgia when I first walked into this place and tasted the pizza was powerful... the pizza is truly one of the best in the city and the vibe is great..  totally unpretentious and normal for a change, like *actual* New Jerseyans.  Thanks, guys!
author: Em P.

description: I'm a NYer and keep searching for good pizza in the Bay Area. I only eat plain cheese so i can't say if the other pies were good but the plain cheese was pretty tasty. The crust was nice & thin and crispy. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a slice or 2. It's a small menu, so don't expect many choices. Oh and it's cash only.
author: illy m.

description: Moving from New York to the Bay area meant eating more Mexican and just not eating pizza.  The idea that someone would have the audacity to recommend Escape from New York or Zacharys as viable options is appalling.  The Pizza Shop aims to satisfy the needs of grabbing a slice or two of solid solid pizza.  It doesn't try to be a fancy sit down place, just a consistantly great slice of pizza.  I have pizza in my life again, and it makes living in San Francisco almost worth it.
author: David G.

description: Dude. Finally, killer NY pizza in SF.
author: Jon-Pierre M.

description: WOW. Amazing east coast thin slice. The cheese is runny, the crust is thin and crispy. There is so much flavor in his slices. I had a white broccoli, mushroom and cheese; the ultimate test. All of them were on point. The best was a white zucchini I sample don't on way out. Cheese slices were $3; topping $4. The decor is great with a couple of whitetail deer on the wall. Staff is super friendly. Bring your friends and try some pie.
author: Brian B.

description: I'm an East Coast snob who constantly berates the quality of West Coast pizza, but the owner of this place is supposedly from New Jersey and it shows in the pizza. Nice thin crust, just like I used to get back home in CT (but go to anywhere in New Haven and you'll get this quality).
author: Sean A.

description: Great addition to 24th St.  I can't walk by without grabbing a slice,  the pizza is delicious!
author: Thomas M.

description:
I loved this place. It's pizza by the slice. Super clean and everything is compostable. 

I had a late afternoon lunch. The server was polite but not intrusive and the pizza was tasty. I hope to eat here again.
author: Glencora K.

description:
i moved to the bay area two years ago after decades as a new yorker. pizza is absolutely my favorite food and i have been consistently disappointed with the pizzas i have tried from santa rosa to monterey. this is the first pizza i have had that has tasted anything like real new york pizza. 

this pizza is amazing. the best in the entire bay area.

the sauce has a nice spiciness - not sweet or thick/sugary. i don't know what cheese is used, but it is superior pizza cheese - tasty without being too greasy or salty. the crust is excellent. i ordered a pie to go (18" for $19 tax included is an amazing deal) and requested extra sauce, light cheese and for the crust to be extra crispy - it was phenomenal. the guy that runs the place nailed it - perfect cracker crust, very thin and crispy - the slices did not droop at all. browned/blackened on the bottom of the crust the way it needs to be to really be new york pizza. i was extremely impressed that the pizza was so flavorful and yet there was not a single drop of grease on the bottom of the box when we were done (granted, i ordered light cheese, but still...not a very greasy pizza).  

i found the customer service to be excellent - the guy that runs the shop was extremely considerate and had me check the pizza to see if it was done enough for me. they were busy and both the woman at the counter and the pizza guy were attentive, accommodating and pleasant. pizza man seemed to be sincerely passionate about his food. 

i am extremely excited there is finally pizza this good in the bay area. please eat here so they stay open. there are some fantastic wood-fired pizza restaurants in the area and i have learned to love that style of pizza, but there is just no substitute for real new york pizza - and this is the real thing. the only places i have found on the west coast as good as this were both named joe's (different owners) on hollywood blvd and in santa monica. this is pizza to go out of your way for.
author: Brian D.

description: I have been waiting years to be able to have a East Coast Style Slice of Pizza, with the real Pizza Window with choices. The sauce to cheese ratio is perfect.  This is a no frills pizza place , it's purely for the Pizza connoisseur  (snob).  You know when you order the plain slice and it has that pure taste of the perfect crust,sauce and cheese that is the place you visit over and and over again and make it your home.  If you love quality pizza it really doesn't matter how much it costs.
author: thekidd b.

description: Delicious.  As am East Coaster, I was STOKED to be able to get REAL pizza so close to home.  Heck, anywhere in SF.  Well done!!  My new favorite neighborhood spot.
author: Karen C.

description: Great little pizza joint that serves up some grubbin NY style pizza! Had the supreme pizza and the spinach pizza and was pleasantly surprised.
author: M S.

description: Fantastic thin crust pizza, best in the neighborhood. Good selection of simple toppings, no weird combinations. Crispy crust, fresh ingredients. By the slice. Quick friendly service. Not much space to sit down, more suitable for a quick bite.
author: Rita H.

description: Happy to have this place open. Great New Yorkish style pizza. Flavorful bright tomato sauce, plenty of cheese n charred crust. The couple that run it are also really nice. Hope they continue to do well
author: andrew s.

description:
Great tasting pizza, available by the slice, good variety, and the staff was friendly.

Only bummer was not being able to grab a beer with it, but it's not like that's very far away given the location.
author: Sean H.

description: I'd prefer to keep this short and to the point.  I'm from NY so I know pizza and I like to be direct. This is a great slice!  I'm not sure about $4 for plain cheese.  Under $4 would be more palatable and then extra for toppings.
author: Lisa R.

description: Come here for a solid slice of pizza that will remind you of New York.  This isn't one of those places trying to reinvent pizza with spiffy toppings or odd pairings.  Instead they rely on good sauce and the right amount of cheese.  For California, this is good pizza.
author: Justin B.

description: Seriously... This pizza is absolutely fantastic. Simple little shop that just serves pizza and soda, and that's absolutely all that you need. The thin crust pies have the exactly the amount of crunch I like. Perfect distribution of toppings. You can tell that each pizza is thoughtfully made. I ordered a single slice and the owner kept a close eye to ensure it was warmed to perfection. Friendly owner/staff that clearly are passionate about pie.
author: Alex C.

description: Awesome pizza, thin and crispy, the sauce is super yummy.  I can't believe it's taken someone this long to bring proper slices to 24th St!  At $3 cheese slices (anything with toppings is $4) I'll be munching a lot more pizza nowadays!  Finally!
author: Emily T.

description: Yeah, the lighting *is* questionably dim in here (and it's not some hip rustic look or anything) but, fortunately, it has NO effect on my ability to devour the heavenly pies that this place pumps out.
author: Joe D.

description: Quick and delicious! Crispy crust, stringy cheese, and flavorful sauce. I also appreciated the clean and simple interior. Definitely will be coming back!
author: Zoe H.

description: i love pizza so much i started my own pizza club back in the day, so when i met someone who attended the LV Pizza Expo and made NY pizza at home for leisure, I knew he knew what was up and took his every pizza rec to heart. The Pizza Shop is only about 4 weeks old I hear and it provides really cute and casual seating that can accommodate small groups. This is pretty close to the real deal. NY pizza lovers- delight in it! Cash only.
author: Jeana K.

description: Very good pizza, only comes in one size. Excellent thin crust. Fair prices, wish they'd have better selections. But most of what they have are very good.
author: Khai B.

description: Great pizza for a good price. Lots of options pre-made to be ordered by the slice and good prices on full pizzas. Nice service as well.
author: Kyle K.

description: Excellent pizza. I don't love the olde timey music. Hopefully they'll deliver soon. Cash-only seems unnecessary with Square, etc, but maybe that'll change. The red sauce is super yummy, and the owner is a friendly fella. Not too hipster Mission-y, which is a nice plus.
author: Gregory D.

description: New pizza shop by the slice. Friendly owners and they just opened. Next door to the kombucha shop, across from Philz coffee. Really good crust and a nice selection of toppings. Both the veggie and the spinach pepperoni were yummy.
author: Rrr X.

description: By the slice or entire pie. Cash only. But the pizza is good. Gonna be about $4 a slice. My only complaint is that they should put on more tomato sauce.
author: Will D.

description: My favorite place to go eat real NY style pizza in SF!
author: Zhenya T.

description: The pizza is okay. Had the garlic tomato and the olive mushroom, had them heated to go, but I reckon they're much better fresh.
author: Maximillian M.

description: New York style thin crust: this is the real deal. Get plain cheese or try a white pizza with sliced tomato. Really good.
author: Luke A.

description: Dude, tone down your sarcasm when speaking to a customer who is paying you nearly $5 /slice...i got a pretty sarcastic attitude from owner on 2 separate occasions..I get it, you're from east coast..and so am I!
author: Den M.

description: Love it!  Wish they delivered and wish they had salads, but their pizza is a-ok.  They really do a great job, nice staff, reasonable prices, best pizza around.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
When The Pizza Shop opened up, I was so happy to have something convenient and close to me; I would have been willing to have mediocre pizza slices. SURPRISE, it's a great pizza place! The shop is clean, the staff is super friendly, and my Jersey friends are always happy to go there.

The Artichoke slice has become my favorite...no chunks of soggy 'chokes here; they spread the veggie in with the cheese so each bite some without being overstated. Then, you have these beautiful red puddles of extra sauce on top; which does give small bursts of flavor.  Combine a slice of artichoke and a meat-o; and you have a balanced meal, right?

Wishlist: They only take cash; and sometimes I walk by cause I have no bills in my wallet, only plastic. The hours could also be later; too too many times I've walked by ready to grab a slice but they are about to close and pickins are slim.
author: Chad C.

description: Best pizza I ever overate. The sauces (especially red) and the almost caramelized crispy crust will make your taste buds bloom into full on lovers. Plus the place is run by neighborhood angels. And it's probably the cheapest nourishing tasty unaffectedly swanky date place around. Plus Kind of Blue was playing softly when we were there. :)
author: Allison M.

description: This place is very good. I love pizza and everything was nice, the atmosphere and the people around us. The slices are very large and filling. It is less than five dollars but worth it. My husband and I will come again soon.
author: Catriona A.

description: Pizza Shop is the bomb and I am psyched they have opened around the corner from my place. The crust is super crispy and the pizza is not too greasy. Like NY style, but maybe a little healthier.  Price is right at $3 or $4 a slice. Excellent add to the neighborhood. The reviewer who compared this pizza to Costco should be shot.
author: Jennifer S.

description: The most authentic New York style pizza in the Bay Area.   SF has long needed a place like this.  Heads up: cash only.
author: Val U.

description:
I found the pizza to be just O.K. It looks like real New York Pizza, but is bereft of taste. I could barely taste the tomato sauce. Maybe it's how I grew up in Brooklyn in the 60's where the grandmother would be making home made sauce in the back room.

I also found the interior too stark and uninviting. The owners or staff did not even bother to ask me how everything was.
author: Bruce G.

description: The pizza is not good. The place is really sad. I am not going back. I had the margherita, my wife had one with some veggies. Both were not good. I would not say we are at Pizza Hut level, you come out of the place still in good healthy conditions (not sure for Pizza Hut, though) but it is a long way from being even a decent pizza. The dough is not great, the topping worse. Again: are you starving? You have to choose between McDonald's and this place? OK, get a slice of pizza from this place. But that's it.
author: Luca R.

description:
Having the flu for a couple of days and not eating. I finally had an appetite and stumbled upon this place. 

Really good thin crust pizza. Or pizza in general. Reasonable prices and a lot to pick from in the case. Service was great and my slice was ready quickly. 

Had the white mushroom slice. Flavor was on point but what really sold me was the crunch from the crust. Sauce was tasty but wasn't smothering the slice. Good mix of topping to cheese. Overall, excellent pizza.  

Definitely coming back.
author: Ricardo A.

description: My all time new favorite pizza place.  Im a pizza snob so i believe i know all the best places in SF. This place rules!!!  Really great pizza, very nice people, and not overpriced. What more can you ask for.
author: john z.

description: Best New York slice in SF. Good crust, good cheese, good sauce, simple toppings. The owners are super nice,  the pies are a good price. So much cleaner and tastier then Arinels which makes me happy. It is actually a good thing they don't deliver because I would eat way too much of it. This place is my go to for good solid real tasty pizza and I go to Zerozero when I want fancy neopolitan style.
author: Jannelly D.

description: I love you Pizza Shop!  For over 23 years I have been frustrated with the pizza choices in SF but you have completely changed this.  I crave your pizza and must have it as often as possible. You make the best crust, the best sauce and it folds so perfectly as it should. I am from New Jersey and the only things I miss from NJ are the pizza, the bagels and my Mom. Thank you!!!
author: laurita r.

description: Outside of growing up in Midwood and Bensonhurst in Brooklyn and going to Arinell's, this is the only time I've tasted pizza like this. Just perfectly greasy and extra-cheese is actually extra cheese. I'm never running again. I'm just gonna eat pies, pepperoni, extra cheese, the rest of my days. It's just perfect. I really didn't expect it to be. But then I saw the slices on the rack and I knew what it was. I ordered that pie like I've been ordering it since and there's nothing else now. I'm either eating that pizza or I'm thinking about eating that pizza, trying to convince my person 'we can just order a pie, on the way home, I'll pick it up. Have two each now, have two each later.' Every time I bite into a taco now, 'it's pretty good, but you know what would really go well with this? Like a pie from the pizza shop. Like, you put extra cheese and pepperoni on it, maybe get a soda in a glass bottle on the way home, have yourself a time.' You know, and there's a good juice place next door to, get a juice while you wait if you want to feel healthy before your scarf down a pie. Or just eat the pie. Maybe get a slice while you wait for your pie, like a trailer for the movie you're about to see. I don't know, just if you ever lived three thousand miles away, and want pizza that's like it's from there, then go here. You're not going to be sad that you did. You're going to be happy. You're gonna stop going running. You're gonna realize it's pointless and when your friends say, 'hey, why'd you stop running' you take them here, and they'll understand. And then everyone can finally relax, take a nap, wake up, get two more slices.
author: Sergi A.

description: The slice and price were okay, but I hate seeing a place that doesn't ring your purchase in the till. Makes me wonder why I tipped.
author: diane e.

description: I've said for a while that 24th St in Mission needs a pizza place.  Little did I know that when one finally opened it would replace Arinell's as my go-to for NY-style pizza.  I had a slice of cheese and it was awesome.  Big, proportioned well, and tasty as hell.  Even reheated the crust is crisp yet foldable.  Super happy.
author: Matt C.

description: Stopped in by chance for a slice - The Meat (pepperoni, sausage, and meatball). The perfect amount of toppings, very tasty sauce and high quality cheese, and the crust was light and crispy. A very pleasant surprise! Highly recommend!
author: Marcos S.

description: How can I give 20,000 stars?  I love pizza, am from NYC so I know of what I speak, and have sampled many many SF pizza joints, some decent, most overpriced and poor, with the sweet bland marinara, rubbery dough and other affronts.  Off the top of my head, only 2 are okay - Escape from NY and Arinell on 16th and Valencia.  But Arinell is really greasy and has a mean spirited hipster sign saying not to use a cell phone in their presence (oh brother, get over yourself), and Escape has a grungy ghetto vibe, factory bedside manner and no love in their pies.  Plus I live on the 24th Street corridor in the Mission, a part of the neighborhood that's been desperately in need of a slice of pizza for a long time.  Along comes The Pizza Shop!!!!  It's the best pizza I've had since leaving NYC, incredible toppings, cheese is perfection, the crust is thin and crispy where it needs to be, very fairly priced for multiple toppings and a normal price for cheese, incredibly delicious without any frills or unnecessary bells and whistles.  Classy muted decor, great music, and overwhelmingly popular - people love this place and it's only been open a couple weeks.  I walk by every day and on Mondays, when the owner Tom takes a much deserved day off to rest (he has just one employee thus far and the place is hoppin' with really happy pizza eaters, it's heartening to see), I go "Doh!" because the highlight of my daily jaunt down 24th from Potrero where I live to Mission where the subway is, is a slice from the Pizza Shop.  Tom and his one employee are all smiles, defying the unnecessary penchant of merchants in the Mission to treat their customers like garbage, even if they served nothing I'd go in there for the good vibes, smooth lighting and excellent tunes.  Scratching my head to think of one negative thing to say, so the review is fair and balanced, but it's impossible - this place is pizza perfection.  When I am not there, I think about my next slice.  Someone gave it two stars because they were closed once, that malcontent needs to have his head examined.  This place is gorgeous, my taste buds are in heaven, and I had better hit the gym twice as often now that I've discovered the Pizza Shop because I can't stop going there every day (twice a day I have to admit) - if I ever have a kid I'll name him The Pizza Shop.  Congratulations Captain Tom, you've completed 24th Street in the Mission!!!
author: Evan K.

description: Excellent Pizza, Great Music.  Very quick and friendly service.  Lots of options - all looked delicious. Will be back!
author: Amanda W.
